analyzed: dpa' ba dang bzang po dang rgyal ba dang stong pa dang rdzogs pa ni nam mkha' dang rlung dang me dang chu dang sa'i khams rnams te /

translated: The measure of the middle particle of the second group and the measure of the small dispeller of darkness of the first group is the measure of the great.üîΩIts divisions are five, by the division of sattva.

analyzed: 'di'i dbye ba rnam pa lnga ste snying stobs kyi dbye bas bcu gcig pa la dang po'i tshes gcig gi cha chen po'i tshad bu mo'o //

original: bcu gnyis pa la gzhon nu ma'o //
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa la gzhon nu ma'o //
translated: The twelfth is the young woman.

original: bcu gsum pa la lang tsho ma'o //
analyzed: bcu gsum pa la lang tsho ma'o //
translated: The thirteenth is the maiden.

original: bcu bzhi pa la rgan mo'o //
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa la rgan mo'o //

original: bco lnga pa la yongs su smin par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bco lnga pa la yongs su smin par gyur pa'o //

translated: In this way, the bright fortnight is differentiated by the fifteen parts of the moon‚Äôs increase.

original: de'i mtha' nag po'i tshes gcig gi dang po la mun pa 'jug pa'i dus ni bcu drug pa'i cha zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de'i mtha' nag po'i tshes gcig gi dang po la mun pa 'jug pa'i dus ni bcu drug pa'i cha zhes brjod de /
translated: The first part of the first lunar day of the dark fortnight is called the sixteenth part.

original: de'i mthar dkar po'i tshes gcig gi cha nag po'i tshes gcig gi mun pa la 'jug par 'gyur te dkar po'i cha gnyis pa yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i mthar dkar po'i tshes gcig gi cha nag po'i tshes gcig gi mun pa la 'jug par 'gyur te dkar po'i cha gnyis pa yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: At the end of that, the first part of the bright lunar day enters the darkness of the first lunar day of the dark fortnight, and the second part of the bright fortnight becomes fully matured.

original: de nas gnyis pa yang gnyis pa'i mun pa la 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas gnyis pa yang gnyis pa'i mun pa la 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: Then, the second part also enters the darkness of the second lunar day,

original: gsum pa yongs su smin 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum pa yongs su smin 'gyur ro //
translated: and the third becomes fully matured.

original: de bzhin du de yang nag po'i gsum pa'i mun pa la 'jug par 'gyur te de bzhin du bzhi pa la sogs pa cha bco lnga'i mthar thug pa yongs su smin pa rnams mun pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du de yang nag po'i gsum pa'i mun pa la 'jug par 'gyur te de bzhin du bzhi pa la sogs pa cha bco lnga'i mthar thug pa yongs su smin pa rnams mun pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, it enters the darkness of the third part of the dark lunar fortnight. In the same way, the fortnights of the waxing moon and the waning moon are completed by the fifteen parts.

original: de nas gnam stong gi mthar cha dang po 'char ba'i mtshams dang cha bcu drug pa'i dang po'i cha la sgra gcan 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas gnam stong gi mthar cha dang po 'char ba'i mtshams dang cha bcu drug pa'i dang po'i cha la sgra gcan 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, at the end of the new moon, at the beginning of the first part, RƒÅhu enters.

original: de ltar gzas zin pa rnam pa gnyis te nya la cha rdzogs pa'i mthar zla ba sgra gcan gyis 'dzin cing gnam stong la cha dang po 'char ba'i thog mar ro //
analyzed: de ltar gzas zin pa rnam pa gnyis te nya la cha rdzogs pa'i mthar zla ba sgra gcan gyis 'dzin cing gnam stong la cha dang po 'char ba'i thog mar ro //
translated: Thus, there are two types of eclipses: at the end of the full moon, the moon is seized by RƒÅhu, and at the new moon, the sun is seized at the beginning of the first part.

original: 'dir nag po'i phyogs las la sogs pa sdud pa'i rim pas mun pa 'jug ste de'i phyir spro ba'i rim pas shar ba rnams mdzad do //
analyzed: 'dir nag po'i phyogs las la sogs pa sdud pa'i rim pas mun pa 'jug ste de'i phyir spro ba'i rim pas shar ba rnams mdzad do //
translated: Here, darkness enters by the order of the gathering of the parts of the dark lunar fortnight beginning with the new moon. Therefore, the rising of the parts is done by the order of the emanation.

original: nag po'i tshes gcig sa'i mun pa la dkar po'i tshes gcig nam mkha'i khams @160a * //
analyzed: nag po'i tshes gcig sa'i mun pa la dkar po'i tshes gcig nam mkha'i khams @160a * //
translated: The darkness of the first part of the dark lunar fortnight is the space element of the first part of the bright lunar fortnight.

original: kyi cha zhugs te mun pas sgrib par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyi cha zhugs te mun pas sgrib par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the part of earth is obscured by the darkness of water.

original: gnyis pa rlung gi cha chu'i mun pas sgrib par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa rlung gi cha chu'i mun pas sgrib par 'gyur ro //
translated: The second part, the part of wind, is obscured by the darkness of water.

original: gsum pa me'i cha me'i mun pas sgrib par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum pa me'i cha me'i mun pas sgrib par 'gyur ro //
translated: The third part, the part of fire, is obscured by the darkness of fire.

original: bzhi pa chu'i cha rlung gi mun pas sgrib par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhi pa chu'i cha rlung gi mun pas sgrib par 'gyur ro //
translated: The fourth part, the part of water, is obscured by the darkness of wind.

original: lta pa sa'i cha nam mkha'i khams kyi mun pas sgrib par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lta pa sa'i cha nam mkha'i khams kyi mun pas sgrib par 'gyur te /
translated: The part of earth, the seer, is obscured by the darkness of the space element.

original: de ltar dang po'i sde tshan la mun pa 'jug pa chung ngu'i tshad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar dang po'i sde tshan la mun pa 'jug pa chung ngu'i tshad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the darkness of the first group is of the measure of the lesser obscuration.

original: de nas gnyis pa'i sde tshan la yang mun pas sgrib pa'i bya ba brjod pa'i rim pas te sde tshan gnyis pa de la sde tshan dang po'i mun pa chung ngu'i tshad ni gnyis pa 'bring po'i tshad do //
analyzed: de nas gnyis pa'i sde tshan la yang mun pas sgrib pa'i bya ba brjod pa'i rim pas te sde tshan gnyis pa de la sde tshan dang po'i mun pa chung ngu'i tshad ni gnyis pa 'bring po'i tshad do //
translated: Then, in the second group, the darkness is of the measure of the medium obscuration, since the activity of obscuration by darkness is described in order.

original: de bzhin du gsum pa'i sde tshan la yang mun pas sgrib pa'i bya ba ste sde tshan de la chung ngu'i tshad gnyis pa'i sde tshan la 'bring po'i tshad ni gsum pa chen po'i tshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsum pa'i sde tshan la yang mun pas sgrib pa'i bya ba ste sde tshan de la chung ngu'i tshad gnyis pa'i sde tshan la 'bring po'i tshad ni gsum pa chen po'i tshad do //
translated: In the same way, in the third group, the action of obscuration by darkness is the measure of the small. In the second group, the measure of the medium. In the third group, the measure of the great.

original: de la chen po'i tshad kyi dbye ba rnam pa lnga ste mun pa chen po'i tshad kyi dbye ba bcu gcig pa la byis pa'o //
analyzed: de la chen po'i tshad kyi dbye ba rnam pa lnga ste mun pa chen po'i tshad kyi dbye ba bcu gcig pa la byis pa'o //
translated: There, the measure of the great is divided into five parts: The measure of the great darkness is divided into eleven parts. The child is in the eleventh.

original: bcu gnyis pa la gzhon nu'o //
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa la gzhon nu'o //
translated: The youth is in the twelfth.

original: bcu gsum pa la lang tsho'o //
analyzed: bcu gsum pa la lang tsho'o //
translated: The adult is in the thirteenth.

original: bcu bzhi pa la rgan pa'o //
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa la rgan pa'o //
translated: The old is in the fourteenth.

original: gnam stong la yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnam stong la yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The full is on the thirtieth.

original: de bzhin du gnyis pa'i sde tshan la 'bring po'i tshad dang gsum pa'i sde tshan la mun pa chung ngu'i tshad kyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis pa'i sde tshan la 'bring po'i tshad dang gsum pa'i sde tshan la mun pa chung ngu'i tshad kyi'o //
translated: In the same way, in the second group, the measure of the medium. In the third group, the measure of the small darkness.

original: de nas dkar po'i tshes gcig 'ongs pa na sa'i khams kyi mtshan nyid kyi mun pa smin pa sel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas dkar po'i tshes gcig 'ongs pa na sa'i khams kyi mtshan nyid kyi mun pa smin pa sel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, when the first day of the bright fortnight arrives, the ripening of the darkness of the characteristic of the earth element is removed.

original: gnyis pa la chu'i mun pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa la chu'i mun pa'o //
translated: On the second, the darkness of water.

original: gsum pa la me'i mun pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la me'i mun pa'o //
translated: On the third, the darkness of fire.

original: bzhi pa la rlung gi mun pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa la rlung gi mun pa'o //
translated: In the fourth, the wind element.

original: lnga pa la nam mkha'i khams kyi mun pa'o //
analyzed: lnga pa la nam mkha'i khams kyi mun pa'o //
translated: In the fifth, the space element.

original: de ltar cha dang po chung ngu'i tshad sa rdzogs pa ni smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar cha dang po chung ngu'i tshad sa rdzogs pa ni smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the first part, of the measure of a small unit, is completed in the formation of the womb.

original: gnyis pa rgan mo'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa rgan mo'o //
translated: The second is the old woman.

original: gsum pa lang tsho ma'o ;
analyzed: gsum pa lang tsho ma'o ;
translated: The third is the young woman.

original: / bzhi pa gzhon nu ma'o //
analyzed: / bzhi pa gzhon nu ma'o //
translated: The fourth is the maiden.

original: lnga pa bu mo ste drug pa la sogs pa nub par gyur pa rnams gnas so //
analyzed: lnga pa bu mo ste drug pa la sogs pa nub par gyur pa rnams gnas so //
translated: The fifth is the girl. The sixth and following parts are the setting.

original: de ltar chung ngu'i sde tshan la cha chung ngu smin yang ji srid nag po'i phyogs la gsum pa chen po'i tshad smin par ma gyur par mun pa 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩso so'i bco lnga'i cha 'di dag nub par gyur pa rnams nyi ma bcu drug pa la 'char ro //
analyzed: de ltar chung ngu'i sde tshan la cha chung ngu smin yang ji srid nag po'i phyogs la gsum pa chen po'i tshad smin par ma gyur par mun pa 'jug par mi 'gyur ro // so so'i bco lnga'i cha 'di dag nub par gyur pa rnams nyi ma bcu drug pa la 'char ro //
translated: Thus, in the small unit, the small part is formed. As long as the third, of the measure of a great unit, is not formed in the dark half, the darkness does not enter.üîΩThese parts of the fifteen days, which are setting, rise on the sixteenth day.

original: shar ba rnams nyi ma bcu drug pa la nub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shar ba rnams nyi ma bcu drug pa la nub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those which have risen set on the sixteenth day.

original: de ltar aa sogs sum cu'i dbyangs ni zla ba'i cha'i ming ste dkar po'i cha rnams dang mun pa zhugs pa nye bar btags pas nag po'i ming can rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar aa sogs sum cu'i dbyangs ni zla ba'i cha'i ming ste dkar po'i cha rnams dang mun pa zhugs pa nye bar btags pas nag po'i ming can rnams so //
translated: Thus, the thirty vowels beginning with a are the names of the parts of the moon, the white parts and the black parts, which are designated as the entry of darkness.

analyzed: dkar po dang @160b nag po'i chos gcig la sogs pa 'di rnams kyi dbyangs kyi sngags kyi tshig rnams ni /
translated: The words of the mantra of the vowels of these white and black parts, etc.,

analyzed: l'i: a'u: r'i: a'i: a'a: zhes pa de dkar po'i phyogs la zla ba thig les brgyan pa cha bco lnga'i bdag nyid do //

analyzed: nag po'i phyogs la nyi ma rnam par bcad pas brgyan pa zla ba'i cha bco lnga sgrib par byed pa'o //

analyzed: thung ngu ni zla ba'o //

analyzed: ring po ni nyi ma'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du yon tan ni zla ba'o //

analyzed: 'phel ba ni nyi ma ste ha la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //

translated: Here, the knowledge of the individual withdrawal is that all the readings of the consonants are thirty pure consonants here, the ya and so forth, not included in the reading of the consonants ka and so forth elsewhere, and the group of vowels such as a and so forth.

analyzed: ka la sogs pa'i sde pa de rnams dbyangs dang bcas pa ste dbyangs ni aa la @161a * //

analyzed: sogs pa thung ngu lnga dang ring po lnga ste bsres pa ni bcur 'gyur ro //

translated: The southern and northern courses are each one hundred and eighty days.üîΩIn the southern course, beginning with Cancer, the sun moves through six signs, beginning with the sky, in the order of the forward sequence, together with the six short vowels.

original: de nas byang du bgrod pa las la sogs pa'i dbye bas dbyangs ring po dang bcas pa'i sde pa drug zla ba drug gis spyod do //üîΩgang du dbyangs thung ngu dang bcas pa spyod pa der mtshan mo 'phel bar 'gyur ro //

translated: In the northern course, beginning with Capricorn, the sun moves through six signs, beginning with the earth, in the order of the reverse sequence, together with the six long vowels.üîΩWhen the sun moves through the signs with short vowels, the nights lengthen.

original: byang du bgrod pa la gsal byed gnyis brtsegs pa dbyangs ring po dang ldan pa ste gnyis ka nyi ma'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: byang du bgrod pa la gsal byed gnyis brtsegs pa dbyangs ring po dang ldan pa ste gnyis ka nyi ma'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The two consonants stacked up in the north are endowed with a long vowel, and both have the characteristics of the sun.

original: gsal byed gcig dbyangs ring po dang ldan pa ni zla ba dang nyi ma'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal byed gcig dbyangs ring po dang ldan pa ni zla ba dang nyi ma'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: A single consonant endowed with a long vowel becomes the nature of the moon and sun.

original: de bzhin du gsal byed gnyis brtsegs pa dbyangs thung ngu dang ldan pa ni nyi ma dang zla ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsal byed gnyis brtsegs pa dbyangs thung ngu dang ldan pa ni nyi ma dang zla ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, a pair of consonants stacked up and endowed with a short vowel becomes the nature of the sun and moon.

original: de bzhin du dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi dbye bas zla ba rnam pa gnyis dang nyi ma rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi dbye bas zla ba rnam pa gnyis dang nyi ma rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Thus, by the division of vowels and consonants, there are two kinds of moon and two kinds of sun.

original: de bzhin du yon tan dang 'phel ba dang ldan pa'i gsal byed rnams rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yon tan dang 'phel ba dang ldan pa'i gsal byed rnams rig par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the consonants endowed with qualities and increase should be understood.

original: zhes pa ni bgrod pa'i dbye bas nyi ma'i rkang pa'i dbyangs kyi dbye ba dang dbyangs kyi dbye ba gzhan nam mkha' la sogs pa dkyil 'khor lnga 'bab pas sum brgya drug cu'i dbye bas tha dad pa ni 'chad par 'gyur bas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bgrod pa'i dbye bas nyi ma'i rkang pa'i dbyangs kyi dbye ba dang dbyangs kyi dbye ba gzhan nam mkha' la sogs pa dkyil 'khor lnga 'bab pas sum brgya drug cu'i dbye bas tha dad pa ni 'chad par 'gyur bas bshad par bya'o //
translated: This is the division of the path, the division of the vowels of the solar feet, and the division of the other vowels, the five mandalas of space and so forth, which are different by the division of three hundred and sixty.

original: 'di'i mdor bsdus pa rgyud kyi rgyal po sgyu 'phrul dra ba las ;
analyzed: 'di'i mdor bsdus pa rgyud kyi rgyal po sgyu 'phrul dra ba las ;
translated: The brief summary of this is from the King of Tantras, the Net of Illusion:

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs chen po //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs chen po //
translated: The great mind of all the Buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs la gnas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs la gnas //
translated: Dwelling in the mind of all the Buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi sku chen po //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi sku chen po //
translated: The great body of all the Buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi gsung yang yin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi gsung yang yin //
translated: And also the speech of all the Buddhas,

original: rdo rje nyi ma snang ba che //
analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma snang ba che //
translated: The vajra sun of great illumination,

original: rdo rje zla ba dri med 'od //
analyzed: rdo rje zla ba dri med 'od //
translated: The vajra moon of stainless light,

original: chags bral dang po chags pa che //
analyzed: chags bral dang po chags pa che //
translated: The first separation from attachment, the great attachment,

original: kha dog sna tshogs 'bar ba'i 'od //
analyzed: kha dog sna tshogs 'bar ba'i 'od //
translated: The light of blazing variegated colors.

original: ces bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: Thus has the Blessed One declared.

original: 'dir dkar po'i phyogs la lnga pa dang bcu pa dang nya ni chags pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir dkar po'i phyogs la lnga pa dang bcu pa dang nya ni chags pa'o //
translated: Here, the fifth, the tenth, and the fifteenth of the bright fortnight are the attachments.

original: nag po'i phyogs la lnga pa dang bcu pa dang gnam stong ni chags bral lo /
analyzed: nag po'i phyogs la lnga pa dang bcu pa dang gnam stong ni chags bral lo /
translated: The dark lunar phases, the fifth, the tenth, and the thirtieth, are the phase of separation from passion.

original: 'di gnyis kyi dbus rdzogs pa gsum gyi mjug dga' bral gyi mthar stong pa chen po yi ge lnga gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa'i rnal 'byor ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thugs te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi dbus rdzogs pa gsum gyi mjug dga' bral gyi mthar stong pa chen po yi ge lnga gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa'i rnal 'byor ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thugs te /
translated: The yoga of the three perfections in the middle of these two, at the end of the phase of separation from passion, is the mind of the transcendent ones, the great emptiness, the five syllables merged into one.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs chen po ni zla ba cha bcu drug pa'i mthar stong pa chen po'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs chen po ni zla ba cha bcu drug pa'i mthar stong pa chen po'o //
translated: Therefore, the great mind of all buddhas is the great emptiness at the end of the moon of sixteen parts.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs la gnas ni gnam stong gi mtha' cha dang po 'char ba'i mtshams nyi ma mun pa bcu drug pa'i mthar thig le stong pa yi ge drug go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs la gnas ni gnam stong gi mtha' cha dang po 'char ba'i mtshams nyi ma mun pa bcu drug pa'i mthar thig le stong pa yi ge drug go //
translated: The place where the mind of all buddhas abides is the juncture of the arising of the first part at the end of the thirtieth, the juncture of the sun and the sixteenfold darkness at the end of the drop of emptiness, the six syllables.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kun gyis  s'u che ba ni stong pa chen po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kun gyis  s'u che ba ni stong pa chen po'o //
translated: Similarly, the great bliss of all buddhas is the great emptiness.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi gsung yang yin ni thig le stong pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi gsung yang yin ni thig le stong pa'o //
translated: The speech of all buddhas is the empty drop.

original: rdo rje nyi ma snang ba che ni thig le stong pa yi ge drug go //
analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma snang ba che ni thig le stong pa yi ge drug go //
translated: The great light of the vajra sun is the empty drop, the six syllables.

original: rdo rje zla ba dri med 'od ni stong @163a * //
analyzed: rdo rje zla ba dri med 'od ni stong @163a * //
translated: The stainless light of the vajra moon is empty.üîΩ

original: pa chen po yi ge lnga'o //
analyzed: pa chen po yi ge lnga'o //
translated: The vajra moon, stainless light, is the five letters of great emptiness.

original: shes rab dang thabs kyi chos ni 'chad par 'gyur pa las rgya cher brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyi chos ni 'chad par 'gyur pa las rgya cher brjod par bya ste /
translated: The phenomena of wisdom and method will be described extensively in the future.

original: gsang sngags skye gnas yi ge med //
analyzed: gsang sngags skye gnas yi ge med //
translated: The birth of mantra is without letters.

original: gsang sngags chen po rigs gsum pa yang rgya cher ro //
analyzed: gsang sngags chen po rigs gsum pa yang rgya cher ro //
translated: The great mantra of the three families is also extensive.

original: da ni nyin zhag so so'i mtshan mo dang nyin mo'i chu tshod gsungs pa ha sogs dbyangs rnams dag kyang chu tshod ces pa ste ha la sogs pa de dag dbyangs kyang yin pas na ha sogs dbyangs rnams so //
analyzed: da ni nyin zhag so so'i mtshan mo dang nyin mo'i chu tshod gsungs pa ha sogs dbyangs rnams dag kyang chu tshod ces pa ste ha la sogs pa de dag dbyangs kyang yin pas na ha sogs dbyangs rnams so //
translated: Now, the hours of night and day are taught. The vowels beginning with ha are also hours. Since those beginning with ha are also vowels, they are the vowels beginning with ha.

original: kyang yig gis gzhan gsal byed do //
analyzed: kyang yig gis gzhan gsal byed do //
translated: The word also clarifies the other consonants.

original: de dag dbyangs bcu gnyis dang bcas pa ni dbyangs drug cur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag dbyangs bcu gnyis dang bcas pa ni dbyangs drug cur 'gyur ro //
translated: Together with the twelve vowels, they become sixty vowels.

original: de la mtshan mo 'phel ba la dbyangs thung ngu dang ldan pa'i dbyangs sum cu'i bdag nyid nyi ma phyed nas mtshan phyed kyi bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la mtshan mo 'phel ba la dbyangs thung ngu dang ldan pa'i dbyangs sum cu'i bdag nyid nyi ma phyed nas mtshan phyed kyi bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: There, in the waxing of the night, the thirty vowels endowed with short vowels occur from noon to midnight.

original: nyin mo 'phel ba la dbyangs ring po dang ldan pa sum cu mtshan phyed nas nyi ma phyed kyi bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyin mo 'phel ba la dbyangs ring po dang ldan pa sum cu mtshan phyed nas nyi ma phyed kyi bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: The thirty [vowels] with long [vowels] increase during the day, from midnight to noon.

original: de ltar nyin zhag so so la mtshan mo dang nyin mo 'phel ba rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar nyin zhag so so la mtshan mo dang nyin mo 'phel ba rig par bya'o //

original: zhes pa nyin mo ste bsam pa'i dbye bas thabs dang lus kyi dbye bas shes rab po //
analyzed: zhes pa nyin mo ste bsam pa'i dbye bas thabs dang lus kyi dbye bas shes rab po //
translated: This is the day, and by the division of thought it is means, and by the division of body it is insight.

original: khu ba dang zla ba ni shes rab kyi bsam pa las byung ba nyid kyi phyir shes rab dang / thabs kyi lus las byung ba nyid kyi phyir thabs so //
analyzed: khu ba dang zla ba ni shes rab kyi bsam pa las byung ba nyid kyi phyir shes rab dang / thabs kyi lus las byung ba nyid kyi phyir thabs so //
translated: Semen and the moon are insight, because they arise from the thought of insight, and they are means, because they arise from the body of means.

original: de bzhin du rdul dang / nyi ma ni thabs kyi bsam pa las byung ba nyid kyi phyir thabs dang / shes rab kyi lus las byung ba nyid kyi phyir shes rab ste de ltar thams cad du rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdul dang / nyi ma ni thabs kyi bsam pa las byung ba nyid kyi phyir thabs dang / shes rab kyi lus las byung ba nyid kyi phyir shes rab ste de ltar thams cad du rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the dust and the sun are means, because they arise from the thought of means, and they are insight, because they arise from the body of insight. Thus it should be understood in all cases.

original: da ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba khams gsum pa'i sngags gsungs pa lha mi gdengs can 'byung po'i skye gnas dag kyang sngags shes pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: da ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba khams gsum pa'i sngags gsungs pa lha mi gdengs can 'byung po'i skye gnas dag kyang sngags shes pa zhes pa ste /
translated: Now he states the mantra of the three worlds, both moving and unmoving: ‚ÄúThe gods, humans, serpents, and spirits are born in the wombs of the mantras.‚Äù

original: lha ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang / @163b gzugs med pa ste lha ma yin yang de'i nang du 'dus so //
analyzed: lha ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang / @163b gzugs med pa ste lha ma yin yang de'i nang du 'dus so //
translated: The gods are those of the desire, form, and formless realms, and the demigods are included in that.

original: mi dang gdengs can ni rab tu grags pa ste rgyal po dang mtha' yas la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi dang gdengs can ni rab tu grags pa ste rgyal po dang mtha' yas la sogs pa'o //
translated: Men and serpents are well known, such as King and Ananta.

original: 'byung po'i skye gnas ni sngar brjod pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'byung po'i skye gnas ni sngar brjod pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The abodes of beings are the four types mentioned above.

original: brtan pa'i skye gnas ni lhun po dang shing la sogs pa ste de dag thams cad sngags kyi ming gis ming can du byas pa'i sngags su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtan pa'i skye gnas ni lhun po dang shing la sogs pa ste de dag thams cad sngags kyi ming gis ming can du byas pa'i sngags su 'gyur ro //
translated: The abodes of the firm are Mount Meru, trees, and so on. All of these become mantras when their names are made into mantra names.

original: khams gsum po 'dir gang gi ming gang yin pa de'i de bsgrub pa'i slad du sngags kyi brdar 'gyur te dang po'i yi ge ni ye shes kyi sa bon du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: khams gsum po 'dir gang gi ming gang yin pa de'i de bsgrub pa'i slad du sngags kyi brdar 'gyur te dang po'i yi ge ni ye shes kyi sa bon du 'gyur zhing /
translated: In this threefold world, whatever the name of someone, for the sake of accomplishing that, it becomes the symbolic mantra. The first letter becomes the seed of wisdom,

original: ming mtha' dag ni bzlas pa'i sngags su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming mtha' dag ni bzlas pa'i sngags su 'gyur ro //
translated: and the entire name becomes the mantra to be repeated.

original: don sna tshogs bsgrub pa'i slad du sems can mtha' yas pa'i ming gi dbye bas sngags mtha' yas par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: don sna tshogs bsgrub pa'i slad du sems can mtha' yas pa'i ming gi dbye bas sngags mtha' yas par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: For the sake of accomplishing various aims, one should understand that there are infinite mantras by the classification of the names of infinite sentient beings.

original: dper na dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu'i don du ming gi yi ge dang pos khyim dang ming gi yi ge thams cad kyis kyang dbyangs dman pa dang lhag pa g-yul 'gyed pa'o //
analyzed: dper na dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu'i don du ming gi yi ge dang pos khyim dang ming gi yi ge thams cad kyis kyang dbyangs dman pa dang lhag pa g-yul 'gyed pa'o //
translated: For example, for the sake of the result of virtue and non-virtue, with the first letter of the name, one should fight with the house, and with all the letters of the name, with the vowels, the inferior and superior.

original: de bzhin du dang po'i yi ge dang ming thams cad kyis kyang bsgom pa dang bzlas pa'i bya ba 'grub ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dang po'i yi ge dang ming thams cad kyis kyang bsgom pa dang bzlas pa'i bya ba 'grub ste /
translated: In the same way, with the first letter and all the names, one should accomplish the acts of meditation and recitation.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la 'khrul pa med cing nor bu dang sngags dang / sman rnams kyi mthu rang gi sems yongs su gyur pa las 'byung ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la 'khrul pa med cing nor bu dang sngags dang / sman rnams kyi mthu rang gi sems yongs su gyur pa las 'byung ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
translated: The power of the dependent origination, the gem, the mantra, and the medicine, which arises from the transformation of one's own mind, is inconceivable.

original: aa sogs ka sogs ldan pa dag las zhes pa la aa sogs ni aa yig la sogs pa ste dbyangs kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: aa sogs ka sogs ldan pa dag las zhes pa la aa sogs ni aa yig la sogs pa ste dbyangs kyi tshogs so //

analyzed: ka sogs ldan pa ni ka yig la sogs pa gsal byed dang ldan pa dag las so //

original: de ltar ni brjod pa'i rim pa 'dis so //

original: khams gsum dag ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams te nges par skyed par 'gyur ro //

original: mi'i bdag ces pa ni bod pa'o //

translated: The lips and teeth are the places of origin of the water and earth elements, respectively. The vowels are born in those places in the same order as they are enumerated. ‚Äú Birth‚Äù means the understanding of the meaning of the sounds expressed in those places.

original: 'dir sngags kyi bzlas pa'i cho ga bsgrub pa'i don du skye ba'i gnas rig par bya ste gzhan ni bsgom pa'i gnas kyi don du lus kyi 'khor lo'i dbye bas brjod pa /

original: gzugs dang sa'i khams kyi lhag pa'i lha dang ldan pa lte ba'i 'khor lo ste de ltar phung po khams kyi lhag pa'i lha dang ldan pa la'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang sa'i khams kyi lhag pa'i lha dang ldan pa lte ba'i 'khor lo ste de ltar phung po khams kyi lhag pa'i lha dang ldan pa la'o //
translated: The wheel at the navel is endowed with the deities of the elements of form and earth.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba la yan lag dgod pa la sogs pa rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba la yan lag dgod pa la sogs pa rig par bya'o //
translated: The arrangement of the limbs and so forth should be understood in the following explanation.

original: dbyangs rnams kyi skye ba'i gnas nges par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dbyangs rnams kyi skye ba'i gnas nges par bstan pa'o //
translated: The definite teaching on the place of birth of the vowels.

original: dpal mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las bsdus pa rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las 'jig rten gyi khams bsdus pa'i mdor bsdus te bdun pa'o /üîΩ// / da ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad gsungs pa sdud par mdzad pa po 'jam dpal gyis tshigs su bcad pa bcu pa la sogs pas mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las bsdus pa rlung gi mtha'
analyzed: dpal mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las bsdus pa rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las 'jig rten gyi khams bsdus pa'i mdor bsdus te bdun pa'o / // / da ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad gsungs pa sdud par mdzad pa po 'jam dpal gyis tshigs su bcad pa bcu pa la sogs pas mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las bsdus pa rlung gi mtha'
translated: The glorious KƒÅlacakra, the king of tantras, which is summarized from the glorious Original Buddha, is explained in the twelve-thousand-verse Stainless Light, in which the world systems are summarized in the seventh chapter.

original: nas lhun po'i mtshams zhes pa la sogs pa de nyid bdag gis dgrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: nas lhun po'i mtshams zhes pa la sogs pa de nyid bdag gis dgrol bar bya'o //
translated: Now, the compiler Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, having summarized the measure of the world systems taught by the BhagavƒÅn according to the capacity of the thoughts of sentient beings, with ten verses beginning with ‚Äúfrom the edge of the wind up to the edge of the mountain,‚Äù will explain that.

original: rlung gi mtha' nas lhun po'i mtshams su dmyal ba gdengs can grong khyer la ni dpag tshad 'bum phrag gnyis zhes pa la 'dir 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu mos pa sna tshogs pa'i sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad sems canüîΩrnams la gsungs shing rab tu snang ngo //
analyzed: rlung gi mtha' nas lhun po'i mtshams su dmyal ba gdengs can grong khyer la ni dpag tshad 'bum phrag gnyis zhes pa la 'dir 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu mos pa sna tshogs pa'i sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad sems can rnams la gsungs shing rab tu snang ngo //
translated: Here, in the relative truth of the world, the size of the world-system is taught and appears to sentient beings according to the power of the various aspirations of sentient beings.

original: don dam par ni 'jig rten gyi khams la tshad dang dpangs med de sems can rnams kyi bsod nams dang sdig pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: don dam par ni 'jig rten gyi khams la tshad dang dpangs med de sems can rnams kyi bsod nams dang sdig pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: In the ultimate truth, the world-system has no measure or height, due to the power of the merit and evil of sentient beings.

original: 'dir phug khrul ba'i tshad gang du 'dod chags dang bral ba'am /
analyzed: 'dir phug khrul ba'i tshad gang du 'dod chags dang bral ba'am /
translated: Here, the measure of the chaotic cave is where there is freedom from attachment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gnas pa'i phug der bsod nams dang ye shes bsten pa de'i mthu dang rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis 'khor los sgyur ba sde dang bcas pa 'ongs shing rab tu 'jug ste de sus kyang ma bskyed cing phug der zhugs pa'i 'khor @165a * //üîΩlos sgyur ba'i sde yang  dog pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gnas pa'i phug der bsod nams dang ye shes bsten pa de'i mthu dang rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis 'khor los sgyur ba sde dang bcas pa 'ongs shing rab tu 'jug ste de sus kyang ma bskyed cing phug der zhugs pa'i 'khor @165a * // los sgyur ba'i sde yang  dog pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: By the power of his merit and knowledge, and by the power of his supernormal knowledge, the Bodhisattva in the cave causes the universal monarch and his army to enter the cave, although the cave is not enlarged and the army is not diminished.

original: don dam par 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: don dam par 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The size of the world-realms should be understood in the same way as the size of the cave.

original: 'dir 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The size of the world-realms is the same as the size of the body.üîΩThe size of the world-realms is the same as the size of the body, because it is said, ‚ÄúAs is the external, so is the body.‚Äù

original: ji ltar phyi rol de bzhin lus zhes gsungs pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshang 'jig rten gyi khams dkyil 'khor gyi don dang / lus kyi tshad lus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi don du ste /
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol de bzhin lus zhes gsungs pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshang 'jig rten gyi khams dkyil 'khor gyi don dang / lus kyi tshad lus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi don du ste /
translated: The size of the world-realms is the size of the circle of the world-realms, and the size of the body is the size of the circle of the body.

original: lus ni dkyil 'khor zhes brjod do zhes brjod do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus ni dkyil 'khor zhes brjod do zhes brjod do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The body is called the circle.

original: de ltar phyi rol du 'jig rten pa'i tshad kyis lhung po'i dpangs dpag tshad 'bum yin pa de bzhin du lus kyi sgal tshigs kyi dpangs khru gang ste khru'i tshad des lus ni khru bzhi'o //
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol du 'jig rten pa'i tshad kyis lhung po'i dpangs dpag tshad 'bum yin pa de bzhin du lus kyi sgal tshigs kyi dpangs khru gang ste khru'i tshad des lus ni khru bzhi'o //
translated: Thus, just as the height of Meru, according to the worldly measure, is one hundred thousand leagues, so the height of the spine is one cubit. The body is four cubits in size, since the cubit is the measure of the body.

original: lhun po dpag tshad 'bum gyi tshad kyis 'jig rten gyi khams 'bum phrag bzhi'o //
analyzed: lhun po dpag tshad 'bum gyi tshad kyis 'jig rten gyi khams 'bum phrag bzhi'o //
translated: The world-realms are four hundred thousand in number, since Meru is one hundred thousand leagues in size.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na ji ltar phyi rol de bzhin lus su mi 'gyur te mi mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na ji ltar phyi rol de bzhin lus su mi 'gyur te mi mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, the body would not be similar to the external world, because it is not symmetrical.

original: de ltar 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad kun rdzob tu ji lta ba de ltar 'gyur du chug mod /
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad kun rdzob tu ji lta ba de ltar 'gyur du chug mod /
translated: Let us assume that the size of the world-realms is as it is in the conventional sense.

original: 'dir bsregs bcad ces pa la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das kyis dam bcas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bsregs bcad ces pa la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das kyis dam bcas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But the Blessed One did not make a promise in the verse to burn and cut up the body.

original: 'on kyang dam bcas pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi yul la yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang dam bcas pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi yul la yin no //
translated: Rather, he made a promise to the object of the accumulations of merit and knowledge.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten gyi khams kyi yul la mdzod kyi 'dod pa dang / rig byed kyi grub pa'i mtha'i bsam pas rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / tshangs pa'i yul sa gcig ni dpag tshad bye ba'i khyon no zhes brdzun du smra ba'i phyir nyi ma'i shing rta la sogs pa yongs su smin par bya ba'i slad du tshangs pa'i yul sa'i tshad de rnam par gzhom pa'i don du gza' dang rtsis dang khyim gyi
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten gyi khams kyi yul la mdzod kyi 'dod pa dang / rig byed kyi grub pa'i mtha'i bsam pas rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / tshangs pa'i yul sa gcig ni dpag tshad bye ba'i khyon no zhes brdzun du smra ba'i phyir nyi ma'i shing rta la sogs pa yongs su smin par bya ba'i slad du tshangs pa'i yul sa'i tshad de rnam par gzhom pa'i don du gza' dang rtsis dang khyim gyi
translated: Because the desire realm of the world is false speech that is the various thoughts of the philosophical positions of the Abhidharma and the tenets of the Vedas, in order to ripen the sun, the moon, and so on, the measure of the realm of BrahmƒÅ is destroyed for the purpose of conquering the planets, astrology, and the houses.

original: 'khor lo dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad rab tu bkod do //
analyzed: 'khor lo dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad rab tu bkod do //
translated: Because the size of the world system is asserted in the Treasury of Abhidharma and imagined in the tenets of the Vedas, in order to ripen the sun‚Äôs chariot and so on, the size of the realm of BrahmƒÅ is destroyed and the size of the world system is set forth in terms of planets, astrology, and the wheel of houses.

original: de'i phyir tshad 'di la sangs rgyas pa'i mdzod mthong nas 'khrul pa 'di mi bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad 'di la sangs rgyas pa'i mdzod mthong nas 'khrul pa 'di mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, having seen the Buddhist Treasury, one should not make this mistake about the size of the world system.

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad 'bum phrag sum cu so drug lhag pa dang / ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tshad 'bum phrag bzhi'i tshad du gsungs /
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad 'bum phrag sum cu so drug lhag pa dang / ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tshad 'bum phrag bzhi'i tshad du gsungs /
translated: How could the BhagavƒÅn be one who speaks falsely, when he has taught that the measure of a world system is 360,000 yojanas and that the measure of a world system is 400,000 yojanas?

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das brdzun gsung ba po yin nam ci zhes pa 'ga' zhig 'dod par gyur na de'i tshig mkhas pa rnams kyis khas blang bar mi bya ste sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das brdzun gsung ba po yin nam ci zhes pa 'ga' zhig 'dod par gyur na de'i tshig mkhas pa rnams kyis khas blang bar mi bya ste sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: If some assert that here the BhagavƒÅn is one who speaks falsely, the words of those who are wise should not be accepted because they are influenced by the thoughts of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang /
translated: Similarly, it is said:

original: sems can @165b mos pa sna tshogs pa //
analyzed: sems can @165b mos pa sna tshogs pa //
translated: Sentient beings have various inclinations.

original: grub mtha' sna tshogs rig pa po //
analyzed: grub mtha' sna tshogs rig pa po //

original: sna tshogs lam la rab gnas pa //
analyzed: sna tshogs lam la rab gnas pa //
translated: They are well established on various paths.

original: shes pa'i nga rgyal khengs pa can //üîΩde dag rang bzhin grub mtha' la //
analyzed: shes pa'i nga rgyal khengs pa can // de dag rang bzhin grub mtha' la //
translated: They are arrogant with the pride of knowledge.

original: ji srid rigs pa ma bstan pa //
analyzed: ji srid rigs pa ma bstan pa //
translated: As long as reasoning is not taughtüîΩto those who are arrogantüîΩwith respect to their own philosophical position,

original: de srid khengs pa can de dag / kun mkhyen gyi yang dbang mi 'gyur //üîΩsems can phan las mi bden pa //
analyzed: de srid khengs pa can de dag / kun mkhyen gyi yang dbang mi 'gyur //üîΩsems can phan las mi bden pa //
translated: even the omniscient one cannot subdue them.

original: bsod nams tshogs kyi rgyu yin te //
analyzed: bsod nams tshogs kyi rgyu yin te //
translated: It is the cause of the accumulation of merit.

original: gzhan la gnod las bden pa ni //
analyzed: gzhan la gnod las bden pa ni //

analyzed: mnar mad la sogs rab tu ster // gtong ba po min yi dags kyis //
translated: is the giver of the highest heaven and so on.üîΩThe non-giver sees his house as a ghost sees it,

original: khyim gyi gnas ni rir mthong ste //
analyzed: khyim gyi gnas ni rir mthong ste //
translated: as a mountain.

original: sdig pa byed pa dag gis khyim //
analyzed: sdig pa byed pa dag gis khyim //
translated: The house of the evildoer

original: khab rtse ri yi rnam par ro ;
analyzed: khab rtse ri yi rnam par ro ;
translated: is like the point of a needle, in shape.

original: / sa 'og dngos grub thob gyur cing //
analyzed: / sa 'og dngos grub thob gyur cing //
translated: Those who have attained power see the underworld

original: lha mo rnams kyi grong 'gro ba //üîΩgrub pa rnams kyis rab brtan sa //
analyzed: lha mo rnams kyi grong 'gro ba // grub pa rnams kyis rab brtan sa //
translated: as the city of the goddesses.üîΩThe adepts see it as a firm

original: kun nas bug pa bcas par mthong //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: kun nas bug pa bcas par mthong // zhes gsungs so //
translated: mountain, with many openings.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni sems can rnams kyi rang gi sems kyi bag chags kyi dbang gis rab tu snang ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni sems can rnams kyi rang gi sems kyi bag chags kyi dbang gis rab tu snang ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the measure of the world-realms taught by the Lord is an appearance due to the power of the instincts of the individual minds of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par zhen pas 'jig rten gyi khams gzigs nas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bos dngos po'i tshad gsungs pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par zhen pas 'jig rten gyi khams gzigs nas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bos dngos po'i tshad gsungs pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: The Tathagata, seeing the world-realms with non-attachment, does not teach any measure of things with the nature of grasped and grasper.

original: de ltar thams cad yongs su mkhyen nas drang srong rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad dang lus kyi tshad dkyil 'khor gyi don du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad yongs su mkhyen nas drang srong rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad dang lus kyi tshad dkyil 'khor gyi don du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: Thus, having understood all, the BhagavƒÅn taught the extent of the world realm and the extent of the body for the purpose of the ma·πá·∏çala in order to ripen the sages.

original: 'dir rlung gi mtha' nas lhun po'i mtshams su zhes pa ni sa dang chu dang me'i dkyil 'khor rnams kyi 'og na rlung gi dkyil 'khor nam mkha'i khams la rnam par gnas te /
analyzed: 'dir rlung gi mtha' nas lhun po'i mtshams su zhes pa ni sa dang chu dang me'i dkyil 'khor rnams kyi 'og na rlung gi dkyil 'khor nam mkha'i khams la rnam par gnas te /
translated: Here, from the edge of the wind to the edge of Meru means that below the ma·πá·∏çalas of earth, water, and fire, the ma·πá·∏çala of wind abides in the element of space.

original: rlung gi mtha' de nas lhun po'i bar du dmyal ba'i gnas bdun dang brgyad pa ni gdengs can gyi grong khyer te /
analyzed: rlung gi mtha' de nas lhun po'i bar du dmyal ba'i gnas bdun dang brgyad pa ni gdengs can gyi grong khyer te /
translated: From the edge of the wind to the edge of Meru, there are seven hells and the eighth is the city of the nƒÅgas.

analyzed: dmyal ba gdengs can grong khyer la ni dpag tshad 'bum phrag gnyis yin no //
translated: The hell and the city of the nƒÅgas are two hundred thousand yojanas.

original: 'dir rlung gi dkyil 'khor stong phrag lnga bcur 'gyur te drag po'i rlung chen po dang mun pa chen po de la dmyal ba'i gnas gnyis steng 'og tu dpag tshad stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga'i cha ste rgya'i tshad ni sa'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshad do //
analyzed: 'dir rlung gi dkyil 'khor stong phrag lnga bcur 'gyur te drag po'i rlung chen po dang mun pa chen po de la dmyal ba'i gnas gnyis steng 'og tu dpag tshad stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga'i cha ste rgya'i tshad ni sa'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshad do //
translated: The circle of fire is 25,000 yojanas in height.

analyzed: de bzhin du me'i dkyil 'khor la dmyal ba'i gnas gnyis te / me'i dmyal ba gcig @166a * //
translated: There are two hells in the circle of fire:

analyzed: dang de'i steng du du ba mi bzad pa'i dmyal ba'o //
translated: one is the hell of fire and the other is the hell of unbearable smoke above the hell of fire.üîΩThere are two hells in the circle of water:

original: de bzhin du chu'i dkyil 'khor la dmyal ba gnyis te 'dam gyi chu 'dam dang chu yang dag par ldan pa dang bye ma'i chu bye ma dang chu yang dag par ldan pa ste grang ba chen po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chu'i dkyil 'khor la dmyal ba gnyis te 'dam gyi chu 'dam dang chu yang dag par ldan pa dang bye ma'i chu bye ma dang chu yang dag par ldan pa ste grang ba chen po'o //

original: sa'i dkyil 'khor la gseg ma chu'i dmyal ba dpag tshad stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
analyzed: sa'i dkyil 'khor la gseg ma chu'i dmyal ba dpag tshad stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
translated: There is the hell of gravel in the circle of earth, 25,000 yojanas in height.

original: de'i steng du gdengs can gyi grong khyer steng 'og tu dpag tshad stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du gdengs can gyi grong khyer steng 'og tu dpag tshad stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
translated: Above that, the city of the nƒÅgas is twenty-five thousand yojanas.

original: de nyid la tshad rnam pa gnyis te phyed ni lha ma yin gyi gnas yin la phyed ni klu'i 'jig rten gyi gnas so //
analyzed: de nyid la tshad rnam pa gnyis te phyed ni lha ma yin gyi gnas yin la phyed ni klu'i 'jig rten gyi gnas so //
translated: It has two parts: half is the abode of the asuras and half is the abode of the nƒÅgas.

original: de bzhin du lus la rkang pa'i mthil nas rked pa'i bar du khru gnyis te khru gnyis po de nyid cha brgyad du byas nas cha re re la rim pa bzhin du dmyal ba dang gdengs can gyi grong khyer rnams rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lus la rkang pa'i mthil nas rked pa'i bar du khru gnyis te khru gnyis po de nyid cha brgyad du byas nas cha re re la rim pa bzhin du dmyal ba dang gdengs can gyi grong khyer rnams rig par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, in the body, from the soles of the feet to the waist is two cubits. That two cubits is divided into eight parts and each part is known as the hells and the city of the nƒÅgas, respectively.

original: lhun po'i tshad ni 'bum phrag gcig ste sa'i dkyil 'khor de nas lhun po'i tshad ni steng 'og tu dpag tshad 'bum phrag gcig ste lus la rked pa nas mgrin pa'i 'og gi bar du khru gang ngo //

translated: The height of Meru is one hundred thousand yojanas. From that center of the earth, the height of Meru is one hundred thousand yojanas. In the body, from the waist to below the throat is one cubit.

original: de nyid du gza'i tshogs rnams 'khor te gza'i tshogs kyi gnas de nas stong phrag dag ni nyi shu lnga lhun po'i mgrin pa ste lus la sor drug go //

translated: In that very place, the assembly of planets revolves, and from that place of the assembly of planets, twenty-five thousand [leagues] is the neck of Meru, six finger-widths on the body.

analyzed: de nas gdong la lnga bcu lhun po'i gdong mgrin pa nas dpral ba'i mtha'i bar du ste lus la sor bcu gnyis so //

analyzed: de nas brtan pa'i go 'phang g-yo med gtsug tor ni stong phrag nyi shu lnga ste /
translated: Then, the immovable place of stability, the u·π£·πáƒ´·π£a, is twenty-five thousand [leagues].
