analyzed: lus la dpral ba'i mtha' nas gtsug tor gyi gnas kyi bar du sor drug gi tshad do //
translated: On the body, from the end of the forehead to the place of the u·π£·πáƒ´·π£a is six finger-widths.üîΩOutside of that, the single void, free from the three existences, is devoid of qualities, and that is inferior.

original: de'i phyi rol stong pa gcig pu srid pa gsum bral yon tan med cing de nyid kyes  dman pa'o zhes pa ni 'og rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang steng gtsug tor de'i phyi rol stong pa gcig pu ste rdul phra rab so so'i ngo bo khams lnga pa
analyzed: de'i phyi rol stong pa gcig pu srid pa gsum bral yon tan med cing de nyid kyes  dman pa'o zhes pa ni 'og rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang steng gtsug tor de'i phyi rol stong pa gcig pu ste rdul phra rab so so'i ngo bo khams lnga pa
translated: The lower wind ma·πá·∏çala and the upper u·π£·πáƒ´·π£a are the single void outside of that, the nature of individual atoms, the five elements,

original: stong pa gcig pu'o //
analyzed: stong pa gcig pu'o //
translated: the single void.

original: nam mkha' ni ma yin te thams cad du khyab par byed pa'i phyir stong pa gcig pur rtogs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni ma yin te thams cad du khyab par byed pa'i phyir stong pa gcig pur rtogs par mi bya'o //
translated: Space is not, because it pervades everything.

original: de ltar 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad 'bum phrag bzhi ste lus la khru bzhi'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad 'bum phrag bzhi ste lus la khru bzhi'o //
translated: Thus, the measure of the world-realms is four hundred thousand yojanas, and the body is four cubits.

original: khru yang sor nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: khru yang sor nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
translated: A cubit is twenty-four finger-widths.

original: da ni 'dir zheng gi tshad gsungs pa rlung gi mtha' nas rlung gi mtshams la 'bum phrag bzhi ste rlung nas rlung gi mtha' shar nas nub kyi rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi mtha'i bar dang de @166b bzhin du lho nas byang gi mtha'i bar ro //
analyzed: da ni 'dir zheng gi tshad gsungs pa rlung gi mtha' nas rlung gi mtshams la 'bum phrag bzhi ste rlung nas rlung gi mtha' shar nas nub kyi rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi mtha'i bar dang de @166b bzhin du lho nas byang gi mtha'i bar ro //
translated: Now, here the measure of the breadth is stated: from the edge of the wind to the edge of the wind is four hundred thousand yojanas. From the wind to the edge of the wind, from the east to the edge of the wind-circle in the west, and likewise from the south to the edge in the north.

original: brtan pa 'dzin ma'i gzhi la gling dang ri dang rgya mtsho rnams zhes pa ni de nas rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su me'i dkyil 'khor zlum po'i rnam pa dang / de bzhin du me'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su chu'i dkyil 'khor dang / chu'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su sa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: brtan pa 'dzin ma'i gzhi la gling dang ri dang rgya mtsho rnams zhes pa ni de nas rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su me'i dkyil 'khor zlum po'i rnam pa dang / de bzhin du me'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su chu'i dkyil 'khor dang / chu'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su sa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: In the middle of the water mandala, there is an earth mandala.

original: de nyid ni brtan pa 'dzin ma'i gzhi ste de la gling drug dang ri drug dang / rgya mtsho drug go //
analyzed: de nyid ni brtan pa 'dzin ma'i gzhi ste de la gling drug dang ri drug dang / rgya mtsho drug go //
translated: That is the base of the earth mandala. On it there are six continents, six mountains and six oceans.üîΩWith the seventh water mandala, there are seven oceans.üîΩWith the seventh Jambudvƒ´pa, there are seven continents.

original: bdun pa chu'i dkyil 'khor dang bcas pas rgya mtsho bdun dang / bdun pa 'dzam bu'i gling dang bcas pas gling bdun dang / rdo rje'i ri dang bcas pas ri bdun no //
analyzed: bdun pa chu'i dkyil 'khor dang bcas pas rgya mtsho bdun dang / bdun pa 'dzam bu'i gling dang bcas pas gling bdun dang / rdo rje'i ri dang bcas pas ri bdun no //
translated: With the vajra mountain, there are seven mountains.

original: rdo rje'i ri ni rta gdong gi me ste lan tshva'i rgya mtsho chu'i dkyil 'khor gyi mthar 'og dang thad ka'i cha la gnas so //
analyzed: rdo rje'i ri ni rta gdong gi me ste lan tshva'i rgya mtsho chu'i dkyil 'khor gyi mthar 'og dang thad ka'i cha la gnas so //
translated: The vajra mountain is the fire of Horse Face. It is located at the edge of the water mandala, below and above.

original: sa 'dzam bu'i gling chen po'i mthar phyogs thams cad dang 'og tu lan tshva'i rgya mtsho rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: sa 'dzam bu'i gling chen po'i mthar phyogs thams cad dang 'og tu lan tshva'i rgya mtsho rnam par gnas so //
translated: At the end of the great Jambudvƒ´pa, in all directions and below, the ocean of salt water is arranged.

original: lan tshva'i rgya mtsho'i mtha' nas lan tshva'i rgya mtsho'i mthar 'bum phrag bzhi'i phyed de /
analyzed: lan tshva'i rgya mtsho'i mtha' nas lan tshva'i rgya mtsho'i mthar 'bum phrag bzhi'i phyed de /
translated: From the edge of the ocean of salt water, to the edge of the ocean of salt water, it is half of four hundred thousand.

original: bzhi phyed 'bum phrag gnyis te zhes pa lhun po'i dbus nas g-yas g-yon du lan tshva'i rgya mtsho'i dkyil 'khor gyi mthar 'bum phrag gnyis te g-yas su 'bum phrag gcig dang g-yon du 'bum phrag gcig ste /
analyzed: bzhi phyed 'bum phrag gnyis te zhes pa lhun po'i dbus nas g-yas g-yon du lan tshva'i rgya mtsho'i dkyil 'khor gyi mthar 'bum phrag gnyis te g-yas su 'bum phrag gcig dang g-yon du 'bum phrag gcig ste /
translated: Two and a half of the four hundred thousand. From the center of Meru, to the right and left, to the edge of the circle of the ocean of salt water, it is two hundred thousand. One hundred thousand to the right and one hundred thousand to the left.

original: de bzhin du shar dang nub dang rlung dang me dang bden bral dang dbang ldan du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shar dang nub dang rlung dang me dang bden bral dang dbang ldan du'o //
translated: In the same way, in the east, west, wind, fire, nadir, and zenith.

original: lan tshva'i chu'i dkyil 'khor de las g-yas dang g-yon du me dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor 'bum phrag gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan tshva'i chu'i dkyil 'khor de las g-yas dang g-yon du me dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor 'bum phrag gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: To the right and left of that circle of the water of salt, the circles of fire and wind are two hundred thousand.

original: g-yas su 'bum phrag gcig dang g-yon du 'bum phrag gcig ste phyogs thams cad du de bzhin no //
analyzed: g-yas su 'bum phrag gcig dang g-yon du 'bum phrag gcig ste phyogs thams cad du de bzhin no //
translated: One hundred thousand to the right and one hundred thousand to the left. In all directions, it is the same.

original: dbus na lhun po gang gi steng du khyim gyi 'khor lo skar bcas nyin dang mtshan mor 'khor ba ste //
analyzed: dbus na lhun po gang gi steng du khyim gyi 'khor lo skar bcas nyin dang mtshan mor 'khor ba ste //
translated: In the middle is Mount Meru, on which the wheel of the houses with the stars revolves day and night.

original: zhes pa ni dbus na lhun po'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dbus na lhun po'o //
translated: The middle is Mount Meru.

original: de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na gang gi steng na khyim gyi 'khor lo rtsibs bcu gnyis pa skar ma'i phung po mtha' yas pa dang bcas pa'i skar bcas nyin dang mtshan mor 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na gang gi steng na khyim gyi 'khor lo rtsibs bcu gnyis pa skar ma'i phung po mtha' yas pa dang bcas pa'i skar bcas nyin dang mtshan mor 'khor ba'o //
translated: What is it like? On it, the wheel of the houses with twelve spokes, together with the stars, revolves day and night.

original: 'dir tshig 'di la rigs pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'dir tshig 'di la rigs pa ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the reason for this statement?

original: gang gis 'di brjod par bya ba lhun po gzhan yang yod dam ci zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis 'di brjod par bya ba lhun po gzhan yang yod dam ci zhe na /
translated: Is there another Meru?

original: brjod pa 'dir manda ra yang lhun po'i ming gis smos pa des na manda ra las tha dad du bya ba'i slad du tshig 'di rigs so //
analyzed: brjod pa 'dir manda ra yang lhun po'i ming gis smos pa des na manda ra las tha dad du bya ba'i slad du tshig 'di rigs so //
translated: We reply: Here, Mandara is also called Meru. Therefore, this statement is reasonable in order to distinguish it from Mandara.

original: cha drug la ni 'bum phrag gnyis gnyis zhes pa ni @167a * //
analyzed: cha drug la ni 'bum phrag gnyis gnyis zhes pa ni @167a * //
translated: In each of the six parts, there are two hundred thousand.

original: 'dir brjod pa'i rim pas 'og dang steng dang shar dang nub dang lho dang byang gi cha drug la sa'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus nas 'bum phrag gnyis gnyis so //
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa'i rim pas 'og dang steng dang shar dang nub dang lho dang byang gi cha drug la sa'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus nas 'bum phrag gnyis gnyis so //
translated: By this method, the six parts below, above, east, west, south, and north of the center of the earth mandala are two hundred thousand yojanas.

original: srid gsum mtha' dag ni mtho ris dang mi yul dang sa 'og ste /
analyzed: srid gsum mtha' dag ni mtho ris dang mi yul dang sa 'og ste /
translated: The three existences are the heavens, the human world, and the underworld.

original: srid gsum mtha' dag dus kyi sbyor ba dag las rab tu skyes //
analyzed: srid gsum mtha' dag dus kyi sbyor ba dag las rab tu skyes //
translated: The three existences are born from the conjunctions of time.

original: zhes pa chags pa skye ba'i dus kyi dbang gis yang dag par 'dzin pa dang srung ba dang / dbyibs kyi rlung gi dus kyi sbyor ba dag las sems can rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu la nye bar longs spyod pa'i don du skyes so //
analyzed: zhes pa chags pa skye ba'i dus kyi dbang gis yang dag par 'dzin pa dang srung ba dang / dbyibs kyi rlung gi dus kyi sbyor ba dag las sems can rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu la nye bar longs spyod pa'i don du skyes so //
translated: They are born from the conjunctions of time of the winds of passion, protection, and shape in order to enjoy the results of the virtuous and nonvirtuous karma of sentient beings.üîΩNow, the measure of the outer rim is stated:

original: da ni 'dir khor yug gi tshad brjod pa 'jig rten khams kyi kun nas khor yug tu ni thad ka'i tshad kyi sum 'gyur du yang 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: da ni 'dir khor yug gi tshad brjod pa 'jig rten khams kyi kun nas khor yug tu ni thad ka'i tshad kyi sum 'gyur du yang 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The outer rim of the world system is three times the distance of the zenith.

original: zhes pa ni 'dir 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad la thad ka'i tshad kyi sum 'gyur khor yug gi tshad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'dir 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad la thad ka'i tshad kyi sum 'gyur khor yug gi tshad du 'gyur te /
translated: The diameter of the periphery of the universe is three times the diameter of the universe.

original: lhun po la sogs pa nas rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi mthar thug pa gling dang ri dang rgya mtsho la sogs pa thams cad kyi'o //
analyzed: lhun po la sogs pa nas rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi mthar thug pa gling dang ri dang rgya mtsho la sogs pa thams cad kyi'o //
translated: From Meru and so on up to the wind mandala, the diameter of the periphery of the land, mountains, oceans and so on is three hundred thousand yojanas.üîΩThe periphery of the earth is three hundred thousand yojanas.

original: sa'i khor yug 'bum phrag gsum dang zhes pa la sa yi ni sa'i dkyil 'khor gyi mtha'i bar du thad ka'i tshad 'bum phrag gcig ste khor yug gi tshad 'bum phrag gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa'i khor yug 'bum phrag gsum dang zhes pa la sa yi ni sa'i dkyil 'khor gyi mtha'i bar du thad ka'i tshad 'bum phrag gcig ste khor yug gi tshad 'bum phrag gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: The diameter of the earth mandala is one hundred thousand yojanas and the periphery is three hundred thousand yojanas.üîΩSimilarly, the water, fire and wind mandalas are two, three and four hundred thousand yojanas in diameter.üîΩThe diameter of the water mandala is two hundred thousand yojanas and the periphery is six hundred thousand yojanas.

original: de bzhin du chu me rlung rnams kyi zhes pa ni chu dang me dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor rnams kyi rang rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi mtha' nas rang rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi mtha'i bar du thad ka'i tshad ni 'bum phrag gnyis dang / 'bum phrag gsum dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du chu me rlung rnams kyi zhes pa ni chu dang me dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor rnams kyi rang rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi mtha' nas rang rang gi dkyil 'khor gyi mtha'i bar du thad ka'i tshad ni 'bum phrag gnyis dang / 'bum phrag gsum dang /
translated: The diameter of the fire mandala is three hundred thousand yojanas and the periphery is nine hundred thousand yojanas.

original: 'bum phrag bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'bum phrag bzhi ste /
translated: The diameter of the wind mandala is four hundred thousand yojanas and the periphery is twelve hundred thousand yojanas.

original: khor yug gi tshad ni drug dgu nyi ma rim pas so zhes pa ste /
analyzed: khor yug gi tshad ni drug dgu nyi ma rim pas so zhes pa ste /
translated: The measure of the environment is six, nine, and ten times, respectively.

original: chu'i dkyil 'khor la 'bum phrag drug dang / me'i dkyil 'khor la 'bum phrag dgu dang / rlung gi dkyil 'khor la nyi ma ste 'bum phrag bcu gnyis su rim pas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chu'i dkyil 'khor la 'bum phrag drug dang / me'i dkyil 'khor la 'bum phrag dgu dang / rlung gi dkyil 'khor la nyi ma ste 'bum phrag bcu gnyis su rim pas rig par bya'o //
translated: The water ma·πá·∏çala is six hundred thousand [yojanas], the fire ma·πá·∏çala is nine hundred thousand, and the wind ma·πá·∏çala is ten million [yojanas].

original: mi'i dbang po phyi rol srid pa gsum gyi gnas la dpag tshad 'bum phrag gcig nyid gang yin pa //
analyzed: mi'i dbang po phyi rol srid pa gsum gyi gnas la dpag tshad 'bum phrag gcig nyid gang yin pa //
translated: That which is one hundred thousand yojanas, the external abode of the three existences of the lord of humans,

original: de ni sa'i steng gi gnas su lus la rang rang dag gi tshad kyis yang dag khru gang ngo //
analyzed: de ni sa'i steng gi gnas su lus la rang rang dag gi tshad kyis yang dag khru gang ngo //
translated: is one cubit in size in the abode of the earth, in one's own body.

original: zhes pa ni sngar brjod pa'i rim pas phyi rol tu 'jig rten gyi khams la dpag tshad 'bum phrag gcig gang yin pa de nyid rang gi lus la rang gi khru yis khru gang gi tshad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngar brjod pa'i rim pas phyi rol tu 'jig rten gyi khams la dpag tshad 'bum phrag gcig gang yin pa de nyid rang gi lus la rang gi khru yis khru gang gi tshad du 'gyur ro //
translated: By the previously mentioned process, that which is one hundred thousand yojanas in the external world becomes one cubit in size in one's own body, with one's own cubit.

original: da ni phra rab ces pa la @167b sogs pas rdul phra rab la sogs pa rnams kyi dpag tshad brjod de /
analyzed: da ni phra rab ces pa la @167b sogs pas rdul phra rab la sogs pa rnams kyi dpag tshad brjod de /
translated: Now, beginning with the atom, the yojanas of the atom and so forth are described.

original: phra rab brgyad rnams dag gis phra mo 'di gcig ces pa ni 'dir phra rab rdul phra rab brgyad phreng bar gnas pa dag gis phra mo gcig ste phra mo gcig gi tshad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phra rab brgyad rnams dag gis phra mo 'di gcig ces pa ni 'dir phra rab rdul phra rab brgyad phreng bar gnas pa dag gis phra mo gcig ste phra mo gcig gi tshad du 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThis subtle one is one‚Äù means that this one subtle one becomes the measure of one subtle particle, which is the eight subtle particles arranged in a line.

original: phra mo 'di brgyad rnams kyis mi rnams kyi skra yi rtse mor 'gyur ro //üîΩskra yi rtse mo 'di brgyad phreng bar gnas pas skye tshe'i tshad do //
analyzed: phra mo 'di brgyad rnams kyis mi rnams kyi skra yi rtse mor 'gyur ro // skra yi rtse mo 'di brgyad phreng bar gnas pas skye tshe'i tshad do //
translated: ‚ÄúThis subtle one is eight times the tip of a human hair.‚Äù

original: de rnams kyis shig gi tshad do //üîΩde rnams kyis nas kyi tshad do //
analyzed: de rnams kyis shig gi tshad do // de rnams kyis nas kyi tshad do //
translated: ‚ÄúThis tip of a human hair is eight times the measure of a louse egg.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThis louse egg is eight times the measure of a barley grain.‚Äù

original: ltos 'gro nas zhes pa ni de brgyad kyis sor du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltos 'gro nas zhes pa ni de brgyad kyis sor du 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúEight of these is one finger width.‚Äù

original: sor mo nyi ma ni zung gis zhes pa nyi ma ni bcu gnyis yin la zung rnam pa gnyis kyis nyi shu rtsa bzhi ste sor mo nyi shu rtsa bzhi phreng bar gnas pas khru'i tshad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sor mo nyi ma ni zung gis zhes pa nyi ma ni bcu gnyis yin la zung rnam pa gnyis kyis nyi shu rtsa bzhi ste sor mo nyi shu rtsa bzhi phreng bar gnas pas khru'i tshad du 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTwenty-four finger widths is one cubit.‚Äù

original: de bzhis gzhur 'gyur te 'dir ni stong phrag gnyis kyi gzhu yis rgyang grag dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhis gzhur 'gyur te 'dir ni stong phrag gnyis kyi gzhu yis rgyang grag dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Four of those make one kro≈õa, and here one kro≈õa is the distance of an arrow shot by a strong archer.

original: de bzhis dpag tshad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhis dpag tshad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Four of those make one yojana.

original: dpag tshad de yis lha yul la lha rnams kyi tshad dang /  sa la mi rnams kyi tshad dang / nam mkha' la nyi ma dang zla ba la sogs pa 'khor ba'i don du tshad yin no //
analyzed: dpag tshad de yis lha yul la lha rnams kyi tshad dang /  sa la mi rnams kyi tshad dang / nam mkha' la nyi ma dang zla ba la sogs pa 'khor ba'i don du tshad yin no //
translated: That yojana is the measure for the gods in the celestial realms, for humans on earth, and for the sun, moon, and so on in the sky.

original: da ni gzugs med pa'i srid pa la sogs pa srid pa sum cu rtsa gcig gsungs pa //
analyzed: da ni gzugs med pa'i srid pa la sogs pa srid pa sum cu rtsa gcig gsungs pa //
translated: Now the thirty-one existences such as the formless realm are explained.

original: dang por chos bzang bskal ba zhes pa ste /
analyzed: dang por chos bzang bskal ba zhes pa ste /
translated: First, the good dharma eon.

original: dang por ni thog mar ro //
analyzed: dang por ni thog mar ro //
translated: First means at the beginning.

original: chos bzang gi sgras ni gzugs med pa'i srid pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: chos bzang gi sgras ni gzugs med pa'i srid pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The term good dharma refers to the formless realm existence.

original: bskal pa zhes pa ni gang du /
analyzed: bskal pa zhes pa ni gang du /
translated: Eon means where

original: lha rnams tshe bskal par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: lha rnams tshe bskal par gnas pa'o //
translated: the gods live for an eon.

original: gnas de ni chos bzang bskal pa zhes pa ste mtho ris kyi sa'o //
analyzed: gnas de ni chos bzang bskal pa zhes pa ste mtho ris kyi sa'o //
translated: That place is called the good dharma eon, which is a celestial realm.

original: zung ni zung dang ldan pa dag ste zhes pa la zung ni gnyis yin la de dag zung dang ldan pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: zung ni zung dang ldan pa dag ste zhes pa la zung ni gnyis yin la de dag zung dang ldan pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: The two are the two sets, i.e., the four.

original: zung ni zung dang ldan pa dag ste zhes pa gzugs med pa'i srid pa'i gnas rnam pa bzhi zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zung ni zung dang ldan pa dag ste zhes pa gzugs med pa'i srid pa'i gnas rnam pa bzhi zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The two are the two sets, i.e., the four types of formless realm abodes.

original: bskal pa chen po gcig dang / bskal pa gnyis dang / gsum dang bzhi'i tshe'o zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: bskal pa chen po gcig dang / bskal pa gnyis dang / gsum dang bzhi'i tshe'o zhes dgongs so //
translated: The life spans of those who have cultivated the four totalities of earth, water, fire and wind are, respectively, one, two, three and four great eons.

original: ri rab kyi gtsug tor gyi 'og skra'i gnas te zad par stong pa rnam pa bzhi bsgoms pa rnams kyi'o //üîΩde bzhin du tshangs pa'i bskal pa zung ni zung dang ldan pa dag  dgral ba'i gnas te /
analyzed: ri rab kyi gtsug tor gyi 'og skra'i gnas te zad par stong pa rnam pa bzhi bsgoms pa rnams kyi'o // de bzhin du tshangs pa'i bskal pa zung ni zung dang ldan pa dag  dgral ba'i gnas te /
translated: The abode of the hair tuft below the crown of Meru is for those who have cultivated the four totalities of space.

original: zad par rlung rnam pa bzhi bsgoms pa rnams kyi'o //üîΩde bzhin du tshangs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa zung ni zung dang ldan pa dag sna'i gnas te /üîΩzad par me rnam pa bzhi bsgoms pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: zad par rlung rnam pa bzhi bsgoms pa rnams kyi'o // de bzhin du tshangs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa zung ni zung dang ldan pa dag sna'i gnas te / zad par me rnam pa bzhi bsgoms pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Similarly, the abode of the hair between the eyebrows is for those who have cultivated the four totalities of wind.

original: de bzhin du dpal @168a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du dpal @168a * //
translated: The abode of the nose is for those who have cultivated the four totalities of fire.üîΩThe abode of the forehead is for those who have cultivated the four totalities of water.üîΩThe abode of the crown of the head is for those who have cultivated the four totalities of earth.

original: gyi bskal pa zung ni zung dang ldan pa dag sna'i 'og ko sko'i mthar te /
analyzed: gyi bskal pa zung ni zung dang ldan pa dag sna'i 'og ko sko'i mthar te /
translated: Two sets of four eons are below the nose, at the end of the throat.

original: zad par chu rnam pa bzhi bsgoms pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: zad par chu rnam pa bzhi bsgoms pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: These are the four eons of the complete meditation on water.

original: de bzhin du dkar po'i bskal pa zung ni zung dang ldan pa dag mgrin pa'i gnas te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dkar po'i bskal pa zung ni zung dang ldan pa dag mgrin pa'i gnas te /
translated: Two sets of four white eons are at the throat.

original: zad par sa rnam pa bzhi bsgoms pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: zad par sa rnam pa bzhi bsgoms pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: These are the four eons of the complete meditation on earth.

original: de ltar na gzugs can rnams kyi bskal pa bcu drug ste /
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs can rnams kyi bskal pa bcu drug ste /
translated: Thus there are sixteen eons of form.

original: bskal pa bcu drug nas brtsams nas bskal pa re re'i bar gyi tshe'o //
analyzed: bskal pa bcu drug nas brtsams nas bskal pa re re'i bar gyi tshe'o //
translated: The life span of beings is from sixteen eons to one eon.

original: mgrin pa'i 'og de nas brtsams nas 'og rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi mtha'i bar du 'dod pa'i srid pa bcu gcig ste /
analyzed: mgrin pa'i 'og de nas brtsams nas 'og rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi mtha'i bar du 'dod pa'i srid pa bcu gcig ste /
translated: From the throat, below that, up to the end of the wind ma·πá·∏çala below, there are eleven existences of desire.

original: shin tu dbang gyur gnas nas 'dod pa bcu gcig go ;
analyzed: shin tu dbang gyur gnas nas 'dod pa bcu gcig go ;
translated: The eleven existences of desire are from the place of complete control.

original: / zhes gsungs te 'dod pa bcu gcig gi dbye bas tha dad do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: / zhes gsungs te 'dod pa bcu gcig gi dbye bas tha dad do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are differentiated by the eleven existences of desire.

original: gzugs med dag ni aa sogs bzhi po ha 'khrig bral ba rnams te /
analyzed: gzugs med dag ni aa sogs bzhi po ha 'khrig bral ba rnams te /
translated: The four beginning with A are the formless.

original: zhes pa ni 'dir gzugs med la sogs pa rnams kyi sa bon gyi yi ge ni aa yig la sogs pa'i dbyangs bzhi ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'dir gzugs med la sogs pa rnams kyi sa bon gyi yi ge ni aa yig la sogs pa'i dbyangs bzhi ste /
translated: Here, the seed syllables of the formless realms and so on are the four vowels beginning with a.

original: de dag kyang ha yig gnyis dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang ha yig gnyis dang bral ba'o //
translated: They are also free from the two syllables ha and k·π£a.

original: 'di ni stong pa drug tu dogs pa med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa drug tu dogs pa med pa'i tshig go //
translated: This is the statement that there is no doubt about the six emptinesses.

original: ai la sogs pa bcu drug gzugs zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ai la sogs pa bcu drug gzugs zhes pa ni /
translated: The sixteen beginning with i are the forms.

original: 'dir dbyangs bcu drug po gang dag gi dang po ai yig yin pa de dag ni ai la sogs pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: 'dir dbyangs bcu drug po gang dag gi dang po ai yig yin pa de dag ni ai la sogs pa zhes brjod de /
translated: Here, those sixteen vowels that begin with i are called the sixteen beginning with i.

original: ai la sogs pa bcu drug ni gzugs rnams so //
analyzed: ai la sogs pa bcu drug ni gzugs rnams so //
translated: The sixteen beginning with i are the forms.üîΩThe ten desires are clearly the end of the ha and so on.

original: ha sogs la mtha' yang ni 'dod pa rnam bcur rab tu gsal te zhes pa ni dbyangs bcu'i rnam par 'gyur ba gang dag gi dang po ha yig yin la mtha' la yig yin pa /
analyzed: ha sogs la mtha' yang ni 'dod pa rnam bcur rab tu gsal te zhes pa ni dbyangs bcu'i rnam par 'gyur ba gang dag gi dang po ha yig yin la mtha' la yig yin pa /
translated: The transformations of the ten vowels that begin with ha and end with la

original: de dag ni ha sogs la mtha' ste 'dod pa rnam pa bcur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni ha sogs la mtha' ste 'dod pa rnam pa bcur 'gyur ro //
translated: become the ten desires that are the end of the ha and so on.

original: rab tu gsal te lus las gsungs pa yod pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu gsal te lus las gsungs pa yod pa'o //
translated: Clearly, they are spoken from the body.

original: gsal byed gcig pa ka sa'o zhes pa ni gsal byed ka yig la sogs pa mtha' dag so sor brjod pas yang dag par bsdus pa ni yi ge gcig pa ka sa  ra 'gyur te /
analyzed: gsal byed gcig pa ka sa'o zhes pa ni gsal byed ka yig la sogs pa mtha' dag so sor brjod pas yang dag par bsdus pa ni yi ge gcig pa ka sa  ra 'gyur te /
translated: The single-syllabled ka-sa is the single syllable ka-sa, which is the perfect collection of all the individual consonants beginning with ka.

original: ka dang sa brtsegs pa ksha  yig go zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ka dang sa brtsegs pa ksha  yig go zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that ka and sa are stacked, which is the letter k·π£a.

original: de yang 'dod pa'i srid pa bcu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa'i srid pa bcu gcig pa'o //
translated: That is the eleventh existence of the desire realm.

original: srid pa sum cu rtsa gcig dag gis 'dir ni srid gsum du 'gyur zhes pa ni aa yig la sogs pa srid pa sum cu rtsa gcig po 'di dag gis srid pa gsum ste /
analyzed: srid pa sum cu rtsa gcig dag gis 'dir ni srid gsum du 'gyur zhes pa ni aa yig la sogs pa srid pa sum cu rtsa gcig po 'di dag gis srid pa gsum ste /
translated: Here, the three existences are with the thirty-one existences.

original: 'dod pa'i srid pa dang / gzugs kyi srid pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i srid pa dang / gzugs kyi srid pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: The three existences are the existence of the desire realm, the existence of the form realm, and the existence of the formless realm.

original: 'dir @168b srid pa sum cu rtsa gcig ces pa ni gzugs med la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir @168b srid pa sum cu rtsa gcig ces pa ni gzugs med la sogs pa ste /
translated: Here, the thirty-one existences are the formless realm and so on.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four formless states are called: the station of endless space, the station of endless consciousness, the station of nothingness, and the station of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: 'og min la sogs pa gzugs bcu drug ste /
analyzed: 'og min la sogs pa gzugs bcu drug ste /
translated: The sixteen states of form are called:

original: 'og min dang / shin tu mthong dang / mi gdung ba dang / mi che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / bsod nams skyes dang / sprin med dang / dge rgyas dang / tshad med dge ba dang / dge chung dang / 'od gsal ba dang /üîΩtshad med 'od dang / 'od chung dang / tshangs chen dang / tshangs pa mdun na 'don dang / tshangs ris zhes bya ba ni gzugs bcu drug go //
analyzed: 'og min dang / shin tu mthong dang / mi gdung ba dang / mi che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / bsod nams skyes dang / sprin med dang / dge rgyas dang / tshad med dge ba dang / dge chung dang / 'od gsal ba dang / tshad med 'od dang / 'od chung dang / tshangs chen dang / tshangs pa mdun na 'don dang / tshangs ris zhes bya ba ni gzugs bcu drug go //
translated: Akanistha, Sudar≈õana, Atapa, Ab·πõha, Pu·πáyaprasava, B·πõhatphala, Ab·πõha, Atapa, Sudar≈õana, Akani·π£·π≠ha, and the four concentrations.

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed la sogs pa 'dod pa bcu gcig ste /
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed la sogs pa 'dod pa bcu gcig ste /
translated: The eleven states of desire are called:üîΩParinirmita-va≈õavartin, NirmƒÅ·πáarati, Tu·π£ita, Yama, TrƒÅyastri·πÉ≈õa, CaturmahƒÅrƒÅjakƒÅyika, and the six gods of desire.

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / 'phrul dga' dang / dga' ldan dang / 'thab bral dang / sum cu rtsa gsum dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i ris zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha  drug ste /
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / 'phrul dga' dang / dga' ldan dang / 'thab bral dang / sum cu rtsa gsum dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i ris zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha  drug ste /
translated: The six gods who experience desire are called: the gods who control others' emanations, the gods who delight in emanations, the gods who delight in pleasure, the gods who delight in creation, the gods of the thirty-three, and the gods of the four great kings.

original: bskal pa chung ngu drug dang lnga dang bzhi dang gsum dang gnyis dang gcig gi bskal pa'i tshe dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bskal pa chung ngu drug dang lnga dang bzhi dang gsum dang gnyis dang gcig gi bskal pa'i tshe dang ldan pa'o //
translated: They live for six, five, four, three, two, and one eon, respectively.

original: 'dir de'i nang du 'dus pa'i lha ma yin dang mi dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang dmyal ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i srid pa lnga ste /
analyzed: 'dir de'i nang du 'dus pa'i lha ma yin dang mi dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang dmyal ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i srid pa lnga ste /
translated: Here, the gods, demigods, humans, animals, hungry ghosts, and hell beings are included in these.

original: de ltar na srid pa sum cu rtsa gcig go //
analyzed: de ltar na srid pa sum cu rtsa gcig go //
translated: Thus, there are thirty-one existences.

original: gzugs med pa la sogs pa 'di rnams kyi ming gi sngags aa yig la sogs pa rnams brjod pa'i rim pas grangs bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa la sogs pa 'di rnams kyi ming gi sngags aa yig la sogs pa rnams brjod pa'i rim pas grangs bzhin no //
translated: The names of these formless realms and so on are the syllables a and so forth, which are expressed in sequence.

original: 'di lta ste aa a'a aam aa: zhes pa ni gzugs med pa ste zang par nam mkha'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste aa a'a aam aa: zhes pa ni gzugs med pa ste zang par nam mkha'o //
translated: They are as follows: a, a, a, am, ah. The formless realm is empty space.

original: ai a'i ae aee zhes pa ni zad par rlung ngo //
analyzed: ai a'i ae aee zhes pa ni zad par rlung ngo //
translated: The vowels ai, ai, e, ai are the wind of exhaustion.

original: ri r'i aa ra a'a ra zhes pa ni zad par me'o //
analyzed: ri r'i aa ra a'a ra zhes pa ni zad par me'o //
translated: The consonants ri, ri, a, ra, ra are the fire of exhaustion.

original: au a'u ao aoo zhes pa ni zad par chu'o //
analyzed: au a'u ao aoo zhes pa ni zad par chu'o //
translated: The vowels u, u, o, o are the water of exhaustion.

original: li l'i aa la a'a la zhes pa ni zad par sa ste /
analyzed: li l'i aa la a'a la zhes pa ni zad par sa ste /
translated: The consonants li, li, a, la, la are the earth of exhaustion.

original: tshul khrims kyi stobs dang / zad par rlung la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis 'og min la sogs pa gzugs bcu drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi stobs dang / zad par rlung la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis 'og min la sogs pa gzugs bcu drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of morality and the power of the concentration of the exhaustion of wind, etc., there are sixteen forms, such as Akani·π£·π≠ha.

original: ha h'a ya y'a ra r'a zhes pa 'dod pa na spyod pa drug tu sbyin pa'i stobs dang sngags bzlas pa'i stobs kyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ha h'a ya y'a ra r'a zhes pa 'dod pa na spyod pa drug tu sbyin pa'i stobs dang sngags bzlas pa'i stobs kyis 'gyur ro //
translated: The consonants ha, ha, ya, ya, ra, ra are the six in the desire realm, by the power of generosity and the power of mantra recitation.

original: wa w'a zhes pa ni lha ma yin dang / @169a * //
analyzed: wa w'a zhes pa ni lha ma yin dang / @169a * //
translated: The consonants va, va are the demigods and humans.

original: mi ste sbyin pa'i stobs kyis lha ma yin dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las kyi stobs kyis mir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi ste sbyin pa'i stobs kyis lha ma yin dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las kyi stobs kyis mir 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of generosity, one becomes a demigod, and by the power of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma, one becomes a human.

original: la l'a zhes pa ni dud 'gro dang yi dags te sdig pa chung  dus dud 'gro dang sdig pa 'bring gis yi dags so //
analyzed: la l'a zhes pa ni dud 'gro dang yi dags te sdig pa chung  dus dud 'gro dang sdig pa 'bring gis yi dags so //
translated: The consonants la, la are animals and ghosts. By small sins, one becomes an animal, and by middling sins, a ghost.

original: ksha yig gis dmyal ba ste sdig pa chen pos 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ksha yig gis dmyal ba ste sdig pa chen pos 'gyur ro //
translated: By the syllable k·π£a, the hell realm, by great sin.

original: klu'i 'jig rten dang por bsod nams kyi stobs dang / dmyal ba'i gnas dang por sdig pa'i stobs kyis bskal ba chung ngu'i tshe'o //
analyzed: klu'i 'jig rten dang por bsod nams kyi stobs dang / dmyal ba'i gnas dang por sdig pa'i stobs kyis bskal ba chung ngu'i tshe'o //
translated: In the world of the nƒÅgas, the life span is by the power of merit. In the first hell realm, it is by the power of sin.

original: dmyal ba'i gnas gnyis pa dang gsum par bskal pa bar ma'i tshe'o //
analyzed: dmyal ba'i gnas gnyis pa dang gsum par bskal pa bar ma'i tshe'o //
translated: In the second and third hell realms, it is the life span of an intermediate eon.

original: dmyal ba'i gnas bzhi pa dang lnga par bskal pa mchog gi tshe'o //
analyzed: dmyal ba'i gnas bzhi pa dang lnga par bskal pa mchog gi tshe'o //
translated: In the fourth and fifth hell realms, it is the life span of a supreme eon.

original: dmyal ba'i gnas drug pa dang bdun par bskal pa chen po'i tshe'o //
analyzed: dmyal ba'i gnas drug pa dang bdun par bskal pa chen po'i tshe'o //
translated: In the sixth and seventh hell realms, it is the life span of a great eon.

original: brgyad par 'jig rten gyi khams nye bar sdud pa'i tshe ste /
analyzed: brgyad par 'jig rten gyi khams nye bar sdud pa'i tshe ste /
translated: In the eighth, it is the life span of the world's contraction.

original: de ltar srid pa sum cu rtsa gcig gis srid pa gsum mo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar srid pa sum cu rtsa gcig gis srid pa gsum mo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Thus, the three existences are by thirty-one existences.

original: khams kyi dbye bas ni khams gsum mo //
analyzed: khams kyi dbye bas ni khams gsum mo //
translated: By the division of the realms, there are three realms.

original: srid gsum ma lus ni mtho ris dang mi yul dang sa 'og go //
analyzed: srid gsum ma lus ni mtho ris dang mi yul dang sa 'og go //
translated: The three existences without exception are the heavens, the human realm, and the underworld.

original: 'di yang sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rdo rje gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di yang sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rdo rje gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: This also becomes the three vajras of body, speech, and mind.

original: aa sogs ka sogs rab tu dbye ba las zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: aa sogs ka sogs rab tu dbye ba las zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: The vowels and consonants are distinguished.

original: bskal pa chung ngu'i tshad ni chu dang zheng la dpag tshad gcig pa'i dong ste de yang skra'i rtse mo phra mo rnams kyis yongs su bkang ba las lo brgya na skra'i rtse mo re re phyung bas gang gi tshe stong par gyur pa de'i tshe bskal pa
analyzed: bskal pa chung ngu'i tshad ni chu dang zheng la dpag tshad gcig pa'i dong ste de yang skra'i rtse mo phra mo rnams kyis yongs su bkang ba las lo brgya na skra'i rtse mo re re phyung bas gang gi tshe stong par gyur pa de'i tshe bskal pa
translated: The measure of a small eon is a pit one yojana deep and wide, filled with the fine tips of ku≈õa grass. When, after a hundred years, one tip is removed,

original: chung ngu'i nyin zhag gcig go //
analyzed: chung ngu'i nyin zhag gcig go //
translated: that is one day of a small eon.

original: nyin zhag de sum cu'i tshad kyis zla ba'o //
analyzed: nyin zhag de sum cu'i tshad kyis zla ba'o //
translated: Thirty of those days is one month.

original: zla ba bcu gnyis kyis lo'o //
analyzed: zla ba bcu gnyis kyis lo'o //
translated: Twelve of those months is one year.

original: lo brgya la bskal pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: lo brgya la bskal pa zhes brjod do //
translated: One hundred of those years is one eon.

original: de bzhin du de'i sde ni bskal pa bar ma ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i sde ni bskal pa bar ma ste /
translated: Similarly, a group of those is a medium eon.

original: bskal pa bar ma'i sdes mchog gi bskal pa'o //
analyzed: bskal pa bar ma'i sdes mchog gi bskal pa'o //
translated: A group of medium eons is a great eon.

original: de ltar sems can rnams sdig pa'i dbang gis bskal pa'i grangs du mar dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar sems can rnams sdig pa'i dbang gis bskal pa'i grangs du mar dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, due to their sins, sentient beings experience the suffering of hell and so on for many eons.

original: lnga rnams bsod nams kyi dbang gis bskal pa du mar mtho ris la sogs pa'i bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lnga rnams bsod nams kyi dbang gis bskal pa du mar mtho ris la sogs pa'i bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of merit, the five enjoy happiness in the higher realms for many eons.

original: da ni klu'i gnas la sogs pa rnams kyi ming gsungs te ming de la rtsod pa med do //üîΩrin chen snang nas gseg ma'i chu ni dmyal bar nges par brjod de zhes pa ni 'dir gnas gang na rin po che rnams kyis snang ba'i gnas de ni rin chen snang ste lha ma yin dang klu'i 'jig rten de nas 'og tu dpag tshad stong phrag @169b
analyzed: da ni klu'i gnas la sogs pa rnams kyi ming gsungs te ming de la rtsod pa med do // rin chen snang nas gseg ma'i chu ni dmyal bar nges par brjod de zhes pa ni 'dir gnas gang na rin po che rnams kyis snang ba'i gnas de ni rin chen snang ste lha ma yin dang klu'i 'jig rten de nas 'og tu dpag tshad stong phrag @169b
translated: Now, the names of the naga abodes, etc. are stated. There is no dispute over those names.üîΩThe abode where jewels shine is called Jewel Light. Below that, at a distance of twenty-five thousand yojanas, is Gravel Water, definitely said to be a hell.

original: nyi shu rtsa lnga'i tshad de rin chen snang de nas gseg ma'i chu ni dmyal bar nges par brjod de bshad ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa lnga'i tshad de rin chen snang de nas gseg ma'i chu ni dmyal bar nges par brjod de bshad ces pa'i don to //
translated: Here, the abode where jewels shine is Jewel Light. Below that, at a distance of twenty-five thousand yojanas, is Gravel Water, definitely said to be a hell, explained as such.

original: bye ma'i chu zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: bye ma'i chu zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: Sand Water is the second.

original: 'dam gyi chu ni gsum pa ste grang ba'i dmyal ba gnyis so //
analyzed: 'dam gyi chu ni gsum pa ste grang ba'i dmyal ba gnyis so //
translated: Mud Water is the third, the two cold hells.

original: de'i 'og tu mi bzad pa'i du ba ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mi bzad pa'i du ba ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: Below that is the fourth, Unbearable Smoke.

original: me ni lnga pa ste tsha ba'i dmyal ba gnyis so //
analyzed: me ni lnga pa ste tsha ba'i dmyal ba gnyis so //
translated: Fire is the fifth, the two hot hells.

original: de nas 'og tu mun pa ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: de nas 'og tu mun pa ni drug pa'o //
translated: Then below that, darkness is the sixth.

original: du 'bod mun pa chen po ni bdun pa ste /
analyzed: du 'bod mun pa chen po ni bdun pa ste /
translated: Great darkness is the seventh.

original: drag po'i rlung gi dmyal ba gnyis so //
analyzed: drag po'i rlung gi dmyal ba gnyis so //
translated: The two violent wind hells are the eighth.

original: rdo rje me lce dang bcas pa brgyad pa ni dang yig gis te rdo rje khab rtse'i sa'i cha rtag tu rab tu 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje me lce dang bcas pa brgyad pa ni dang yig gis te rdo rje khab rtse'i sa'i cha rtag tu rab tu 'bar ba'o //
translated: The vajra hell with blazing flames is the ninth, indicated by the syllable da. It is the part of the vajra needle that is always blazing.

original: dmyal ba chen po brgyad po rnams ni sa 'og na'o ;
analyzed: dmyal ba chen po brgyad po rnams ni sa 'og na'o ;
translated: The eight great hells are below the ground.

original: / lan tshva chang dang chu dang 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang sbrang rtsi'i rgya mtsho bdun te zhes pa'i lan tshva ni sa'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol na'o //
analyzed: / lan tshva chang dang chu dang 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang sbrang rtsi'i rgya mtsho bdun te zhes pa'i lan tshva ni sa'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol na'o //
translated: There are seven oceans of salt, beer, water, milk, yogurt, butter, and honey. The salt ocean is outside the mandala of earth.

original: chang la sogs pa ni sa'i steng na'o //
analyzed: chang la sogs pa ni sa'i steng na'o //
translated: The beer ocean and so on are on the surface of the earth.

original: ri bo ni bdun te 'od sngon manda ra ri ni sha ta dang / nor bu'i 'od zer tro na bsil ri rdo rje'o zhes pa'i rdo rje ni lan tshva'i rgya mtsho'i phyi rol na'o //
analyzed: ri bo ni bdun te 'od sngon manda ra ri ni sha ta dang / nor bu'i 'od zer tro na bsil ri rdo rje'o zhes pa'i rdo rje ni lan tshva'i rgya mtsho'i phyi rol na'o //
translated: There are seven mountains: blue light, Mandara, Ri-ni-sha-ta, jewel light, Tro-na, cool mountain, and vajra. The vajra mountain is outside the salt ocean.

original: kha ba can la sogs pa'i ri rgyud so so ni chang la sogs pa'i rgya mtsho so so'i phyi rol na chu'i phreng ba 'ching ba bzhin no //
analyzed: kha ba can la sogs pa'i ri rgyud so so ni chang la sogs pa'i rgya mtsho so so'i phyi rol na chu'i phreng ba 'ching ba bzhin no //
translated: The individual mountain ranges, such as the Himalayas, are like a garland of waves in the individual oceans of beer and so on.üîΩThe seven continents are: P≈´rvavideha, Jambudvƒ´pa, AvaragodƒÅnƒ´ya, Kuru, Krau√±ca, CƒÅmara, and A·π≠ara.

original: gling ni zla ba 'od dkar dag dang rab mchog ku sha dang ni mi 'am ci dang / khrung khrung dang / drag po yang ni longs spyod ste bdun pa 'dzam bu mi rnams gnas pa dag ni las kyi sa bdun pa 'dzam bu'i gling chen po zlum po'i rnam pa zheng du dpag tshad 'bum phrag gcig dang khor yug tu 'bum phrag gsum yod pa gang du mi rnams
analyzed: gling ni zla ba 'od dkar dag dang rab mchog ku sha dang ni mi 'am ci dang / khrung khrung dang / drag po yang ni longs spyod ste bdun pa 'dzam bu mi rnams gnas pa dag ni las kyi sa bdun pa 'dzam bu'i gling chen po zlum po'i rnam pa zheng du dpag tshad 'bum phrag gcig dang khor yug tu 'bum phrag gsum yod pa gang du mi rnams
translated: The seven continents are the abode of humans. The great continent of Jambudvƒ´pa is round, with a diameter of 100,000 yojanas and a circumference of 300,000 yojanas.

original: gnas pa de ni las kyi sa dang / drug ni longs spyod kyi sar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pa de ni las kyi sa dang / drug ni longs spyod kyi sar rig par bya'o //
translated: The seven continents are known as the continents of karma, and the six are known as the continents of enjoyment.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling ni lan tshva'i rgya mtsho'i ngogs na ste /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling ni lan tshva'i rgya mtsho'i ngogs na ste /
translated: Jambudvƒ´pa is on the shore of the ocean of salt water.

original: lhag ma ni chang la sogs pa'i ngogs na'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni chang la sogs pa'i ngogs na'o //
translated: The remaining continents are on the shores of the oceans of beer and so on.

original: da ni 'dzam gling chen po la gling bzhi rnams gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni 'dzam gling chen po la gling bzhi rnams gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the four continents of the great Jambudvƒ´pa are mentioned.

original: shar du rlung ni shin tu zlum po zhes pa ni shar du rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin gyis shin tu zlum po ste zla ba nya ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: shar du rlung ni shin tu zlum po zhes pa ni shar du rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin gyis shin tu zlum po ste zla ba nya ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: In the east, the wind is very round, that is, in the east, by the nature of the wind mandala, it is very round, having the form of a full moon.

original: lho ru me'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin gyis gru gsum mo //
analyzed: lho ru me'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin gyis gru gsum mo //
translated: In the south, by the nature of the fire mandala, it is triangular.

original: byang du chu'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin gyis zlum po phyed pa'o //
analyzed: byang du chu'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin gyis zlum po phyed pa'o //
translated: In the north, by the nature of the water mandala, it is half-round.

original: nub tu sa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin gyis gru bzhi ste chu yi gter gyi zur zhes so //
analyzed: nub tu sa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin gyis gru bzhi ste chu yi gter gyi zur zhes so //
translated: In the west, by the nature of the earth mandala, it is square, the corner of the water treasure.

original: dbus su lhun po stong pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin gyis thig le'i rnam @170a * //
analyzed: dbus su lhun po stong pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin gyis thig le'i rnam @170a * //
translated: In the middle, Mount Meru is the nature of the mandala of emptiness, having the form of a drop.

original: pa'o ; / rdo rje mchog gi rang bzhin dkyil 'khor rnams kyi dbus su'o zhes pa ni shar dang / lho dang byang dang nub kyi dkyil 'khor rnams kyi dbus su lhun po'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; / rdo rje mchog gi rang bzhin dkyil 'khor rnams kyi dbus su'o zhes pa ni shar dang / lho dang byang dang nub kyi dkyil 'khor rnams kyi dbus su lhun po'o //
translated: In the middle of the mandalas that have the nature of the supreme vajra, that is, in the middle of the east, south, north, and west mandalas, is Mount Meru.

original: sa'i steng du dpag tshad stong phrag rnams ni ri dang klu dang gza' dang phyogs rnams dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: sa'i steng du dpag tshad stong phrag rnams ni ri dang klu dang gza' dang phyogs rnams dag tu 'gyur //
translated: On the earth, the thousand yojanas become the mountains, nƒÅgas, planets, and directions.

original: dkyil 'khor chen po bzhi po 'di rnams kyi dpag tshad kyi tshad ni grangs bzhin du sa'i steng du ri zhes pa stong phrag bdun no //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po bzhi po 'di rnams kyi dpag tshad kyi tshad ni grangs bzhin du sa'i steng du ri zhes pa stong phrag bdun no //
translated: The measure of the four great ma·πá·∏çalas is, respectively, seven thousand yojanas on the earth,

original: klu zhes pa stong phrag brgyad do //üîΩgza' zhes pa stong phrag dgu'o //
analyzed: klu zhes pa stong phrag brgyad do // gza' zhes pa stong phrag dgu'o //
translated: eight thousand yojanas in the nƒÅgas,üîΩnine thousand yojanas in the planets,

original: phyogs zhes pa stong phrag bcu ste gling bzhi rnams kyi dpag tshad kyi tshad rim pa bzhin no //
analyzed: phyogs zhes pa stong phrag bcu ste gling bzhi rnams kyi dpag tshad kyi tshad rim pa bzhin no //
translated: and ten thousand yojanas in the directions.üîΩHere, since the east is half a circle and the west is square, the body is naturally front and back wind and earth,

original: 'dir gang zhig shar zlum po phyed dang nub gru bzhi yin pa de'i phyir rang gi lus rang bzhin gyis mdun dang rgyab rlung dang / sa'i rang bzhin dang / g-yon dang g-yas kyi lus ni chu dang me'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir gang zhig shar zlum po phyed dang nub gru bzhi yin pa de'i phyir rang gi lus rang bzhin gyis mdun dang rgyab rlung dang / sa'i rang bzhin dang / g-yon dang g-yas kyi lus ni chu dang me'i rang bzhin no //
translated: and the left and right body is water and fire.

original: de'i phyir dkyil 'khor bzhi'i rnam pas gling bzhi rnams kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dkyil 'khor bzhi'i rnam pas gling bzhi rnams kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the four continents have the characteristics of the four ma·πá·∏çalas.

original: da ni lhun po la sogs pa rnams kyi rgya'i tshad gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni lhun po la sogs pa rnams kyi rgya'i tshad gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the measure of Meru and so on is stated:

original: lhun po yi ni steng gi rgya shar dang nub dang byang dang lho'i cha'i bar du stong phrag lnga bcu'o //
analyzed: lhun po yi ni steng gi rgya shar dang nub dang byang dang lho'i cha'i bar du stong phrag lnga bcu'o //
translated: The distance from Meru to the eastern continent is 5,000 yojanas. The same is true of the southern, western, and northern continents.

original: sa gzhi dag gi gnas la rgyar stong phrag bcu drug go //
analyzed: sa gzhi dag gi gnas la rgyar stong phrag bcu drug go //
translated: The ground of the continents is 16,000 yojanas in width.

original: stong phrag gcig ni khor yug dag gi yang dag pa'i zhing ngo //
analyzed: stong phrag gcig ni khor yug dag gi yang dag pa'i zhing ngo //
translated: The distance from the ground of the continents to the outer ring of mountains is 1,000 yojanas.

original: rva ni lnga po rnams dag steng dang sa gzhi dag gi gnas la ni phyir son pa'o //
analyzed: rva ni lnga po rnams dag steng dang sa gzhi dag gi gnas la ni phyir son pa'o //
translated: The four horns are 5,000 yojanas above the ground of the continents.

original: phyogs kun du ni khor yug kyang ngo //
analyzed: phyogs kun du ni khor yug kyang ngo //
translated: The outer ring of mountains is all around.üîΩBeyond that are the continents and mountains.

original: de'i phyi rol gling dang ri bo dag dang zhes pa ni khor yug de'i phyi rol rva bzhi'i khang skyibs kyi gnas su gling drug dang mtsho drug dang ri drug ste de rnams las kha ba'i ri dang rva mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyi rol gling dang ri bo dag dang zhes pa ni khor yug de'i phyi rol rva bzhi'i khang skyibs kyi gnas su gling drug dang mtsho drug dang ri drug ste de rnams las kha ba'i ri dang rva mnyam pa'o //
translated: Beyond the outer ring of mountains are the six continents and six oceans and six mountains.

original: bdun pa ni 'dzam bu'i gling ste de'i phyi rol na lan tshva'i chu gter gyi dkyil 'khor dang thams cad nas me'i dkyil 'khor dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: bdun pa ni 'dzam bu'i gling ste de'i phyi rol na lan tshva'i chu gter gyi dkyil 'khor dang thams cad nas me'i dkyil 'khor dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The seventh continent is Jambudvƒ´pa. Beyond that is the outer ring of salt water, the outer ring of fire, and the outer ring of wind.

original: chu gter drug po thams cad dag kyang zla ba zla ba gcig gis dman pa'i stong phrag re re ste zhes pa ni rgya mtsho drug ste /
analyzed: chu gter drug po thams cad dag kyang zla ba zla ba gcig gis dman pa'i stong phrag re re ste zhes pa ni rgya mtsho drug ste /
translated: All the six oceans decrease by one thousand yojanas each month.

original: rgya mtsho so so la bcu gcig lhag pa'i brgyas dman pa'i stong phrag tu 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rgya mtsho so so la bcu gcig lhag pa'i brgyas dman pa'i stong phrag tu 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The six oceans are each one thousand yojanas less than the previous one.

original: de bzhin du gling rnams drug dang ri rgyud mchog rnams drug nyid de gling dang ri dang / rgya mtsho bco brgyad po 'di rnams tshad mnyam mo //üîΩde nyid zhing mor ni stong phrag bcu drug las bco brgyad kyis thob pa'i chas gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gling rnams drug dang ri rgyud mchog rnams drug nyid de gling dang ri dang / rgya mtsho bco brgyad po 'di rnams tshad mnyam mo // de nyid zhing mor ni stong phrag bcu drug las bco brgyad kyis thob pa'i chas gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, there are six continents and six supreme mountains. The eighteen continents, mountains and oceans are equal in size.üîΩThat is the extent of the trichiliocosm.

original: @170b zla ba zla ba gcig gis dman pa zhes pa ni rtsis de'i tshad mdor bsdus te brjod pa'o //
analyzed: @170b zla ba zla ba gcig gis dman pa zhes pa ni rtsis de'i tshad mdor bsdus te brjod pa'o //
translated: One month is one month less than the previous calculation.

original: 'dir lhun po'i 'og gi cha la tshangs pa'i gnas nas phyogs thams cad du dpag tshad stong phrag brgyad dang khor yug gi gcig go //
analyzed: 'dir lhun po'i 'og gi cha la tshangs pa'i gnas nas phyogs thams cad du dpag tshad stong phrag brgyad dang khor yug gi gcig go //
translated: Here, below Meru, from the abode of Brahma, in all directions, there are eight thousand yojanas and one of the outer ring.

original: dpag tshad stong phrag dgu'i phyi rol dpag tshad stong phrag bcu drug gi bar du gling drug la sogs pa rnams gnas so //
analyzed: dpag tshad stong phrag dgu'i phyi rol dpag tshad stong phrag bcu drug gi bar du gling drug la sogs pa rnams gnas so //
translated: The six continents are located at a distance of 9,000 leagues from Meru and at a distance of 16,000 leagues from each other.

original: de'i phyir stong phrag bcu drug las bco brgyad kyis thob pa'i chas tshad gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir stong phrag bcu drug las bco brgyad kyis thob pa'i chas tshad gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus the diameter of the circle of water and gold is 3,600,000 leagues.

original: de'i phyi rol lhun po'i phyogs brgyad du stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga ni 'dzam bu'i gling chen po'i yangs pa ste zlum po'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyi rol lhun po'i phyogs brgyad du stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga ni 'dzam bu'i gling chen po'i yangs pa ste zlum po'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Beyond that, in the eight directions, at a distance of 25,000 leagues from Meru, is Jambudvƒ´pa, the great continent, which has the shape of a cart.

original: de'i phyi rol phyogs thams cad du lan tshva'i chu gter 'bum phrag phyed kyi tshad du 'gyur ro //üîΩsrid pa gsum po 'dzin pa yi ni mtha' ma dag gi me'i dkyil 'khor dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi tshad dag de bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyi rol phyogs thams cad du lan tshva'i chu gter 'bum phrag phyed kyi tshad du 'gyur ro // srid pa gsum po 'dzin pa yi ni mtha' ma dag gi me'i dkyil 'khor dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi tshad dag de bzhin no //
translated: Beyond that, in all directions, at a distance of 150,000 leagues, is the ocean of salt water.üîΩThe dimensions of the circle of fire and the circle of wind are the same as those of the receptacle world, that is, 1,200,000 leagues.

original: de ltar na lhun po tshangs pa'i gnas nas phyogs thams cad du dpag tshad 'bun phrag gnyis gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na lhun po tshangs pa'i gnas nas phyogs thams cad du dpag tshad 'bun phrag gnyis gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Thus Meru is 24,000 leagues from the heaven of the Thirty-three up to the summit of Meru.

original: lus la brang gi phyed ni sa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: lus la brang gi phyed ni sa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Half of the chest is the earth mandala.

original: dpung pa ni chu'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: dpung pa ni chu'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The shoulders are the water mandala.

original: nye ba'i dpung pa ni me'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: nye ba'i dpung pa ni me'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The forearms are the fire mandala.

original: nor bu'i ching ba nas lag pa'i mthar ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: nor bu'i ching ba nas lag pa'i mthar ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor te /
translated: From the jewel to the end of the hand is the wind mandala.

original: de ltar na 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad do ;
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad do ;
translated: Thus, the measure of the world system.

original: / da ni tshangs pa'i gnas su dus kyi 'khor lo zhes pa la sogs pas dus kyi 'khor lo dang lha dang klu dang gnas dang / nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa rnams kyi gnas gsungs te /
analyzed: / da ni tshangs pa'i gnas su dus kyi 'khor lo zhes pa la sogs pas dus kyi 'khor lo dang lha dang klu dang gnas dang / nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa rnams kyi gnas gsungs te /
translated: Now, in the abode of BrahmƒÅ, the Wheel of Time, and so on, the abode of the Wheel of Time, gods, nƒÅgas, abodes, and nearby abodes are explained.

original: phyi rol du tshangs pa'i gnas dang lus la gtsug tor gyi nor bu la dus kyi 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: phyi rol du tshangs pa'i gnas dang lus la gtsug tor gyi nor bu la dus kyi 'khor lo ste /
translated: Externally, in the abode of BrahmƒÅ, and internally, in the u·π£·πáƒ´·π£a jewel, is the Wheel of Time.

original: de nyid ni rgyal ba mchog bcas yang dag bstod pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni rgyal ba mchog bcas yang dag bstod pa ste /
translated: That is the supreme victor, praised as true.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad dang bcas pa 'dus shing gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa dang / lha'i tshogs byang chub sems dpa' dang tshangs pa la sogs pa rnams kyis yang dag par bstod pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad dang bcas pa 'dus shing gcig tu 'dres par gyur pa dang / lha'i tshogs byang chub sems dpa' dang tshangs pa la sogs pa rnams kyis yang dag par bstod pa'o //
translated: praise them.

original: lhun po la ni tshig  mda' tshangs pa la sogs pa rnams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: lhun po la ni tshig  mda' tshangs pa la sogs pa rnams kyi tshogs so //
translated: The hosts of Maruts, Brahma, etc., are on Meru.

analyzed: sa gzhi'i 'og na gnas pa klu rnams dag ni rigs lnga'i tshogs so //
translated: The hosts of Nagas, who live under the earth, are of five kinds.

original: dpal ldan lhun po'i phyogs rnams kun du ste /üîΩphyogs brgyad du sa'i dkyil 'khor la son gnas rnams kun dang nye ba'i gnas zhes pa la gnas ni phyogs bzhir rlung dang @171a * //
analyzed: dpal ldan lhun po'i phyogs rnams kun du ste / phyogs brgyad du sa'i dkyil 'khor la son gnas rnams kun dang nye ba'i gnas zhes pa la gnas ni phyogs bzhir rlung dang @171a * //
translated: In all the directions of the glorious Meru,üîΩin all the abodes and in the neighboring abodes, which are in the eight directions on the circle of earth,

original: me dang chu dang sa'i rang bzhin gyis gnas pa /
analyzed: me dang chu dang sa'i rang bzhin gyis gnas pa /
translated: the abodes are in the four directions, and are of the nature of wind, fire, water, and earth.

original: shar gyi lus 'phags dang 'dzam bu'i gling chung ngu dang byang gi sgra mi snyan dang nub kyi ba lang spyod do //
analyzed: shar gyi lus 'phags dang 'dzam bu'i gling chung ngu dang byang gi sgra mi snyan dang nub kyi ba lang spyod do //
translated: In the east is Videha, in the south is Jambudvipa, in the west is Godaniya, and in the north is Kuru.

original: nye ba'i gnas ni rang bzhin de nyid kyis phyogs mtshams rnams su ste /
analyzed: nye ba'i gnas ni rang bzhin de nyid kyis phyogs mtshams rnams su ste /
translated: The neighboring places are in the directions by nature.

original: me dang bden bral dang dbang ldan dang / rlung gi phyogs su'o //
analyzed: me dang bden bral dang dbang ldan dang / rlung gi phyogs su'o //
translated: In the directions of fire, nadir, northeast, and wind.

original: de bzhin du zhing dang nye ba'i zhing ni rgya mtsho'i phyed la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhing dang nye ba'i zhing ni rgya mtsho'i phyed la'o //
translated: Similarly, the fields and neighboring fields are in half of the ocean.

original: 'dun pa dang nye ba'i 'dun pa ni rgya mtsho'i phyed gzhan la'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang nye ba'i 'dun pa ni rgya mtsho'i phyed gzhan la'o //
translated: The assemblies and neighboring assemblies are in the other half of the ocean.

original: 'dus pa can dang nye ba'i 'dus pa can ni me'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyed la'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa can dang nye ba'i 'dus pa can ni me'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyed la'o //
translated: The abodes and neighboring abodes are in half of the fire mandala.

original: khang pa dang nye ba'i khang pa ni me'i phyed gzhan la'o ;
analyzed: khang pa dang nye ba'i khang pa ni me'i phyed gzhan la'o ;
translated: The houses and neighboring houses are in the other half of the fire mandala.

original: / dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur khrod ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi phyed la'o //
analyzed: / dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur khrod ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi phyed la'o //
translated: The charnel grounds and neighboring charnel grounds are in half of the wind mandala.

original: dur khrod chen po brgyad ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi mtha' la ste /
analyzed: dur khrod chen po brgyad ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi mtha' la ste /
translated: The eight great charnel grounds are on the edge of the wind mandala.

original: de ltar gnas la sogs pa rnams sa bcu gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar gnas la sogs pa rnams sa bcu gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: Thus, the places and so on should be known as the twelve levels.

original: lus la yang sa bcu gnyis ni lag pa dang rkang pa dag gi tshigs bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: lus la yang sa bcu gnyis ni lag pa dang rkang pa dag gi tshigs bcu gnyis so //
translated: Also, the twelve levels are the twelve joints of the arms and legs in the body.

original: da ni phyogs skyong rnams kyi gnas gsungs pa shar du brgya byin zhes pa ste /
analyzed: da ni phyogs skyong rnams kyi gnas gsungs pa shar du brgya byin zhes pa ste /
translated: Now, the abodes of the directional guardians are stated: Indra in the east,üîΩin the east on the top of Meru is Indra.

analyzed: shar du brgya byin ni lhun po'i steng gi shar phyogs su brgya byin no // mer ni me lha'o //
