original: gshin rje'i phyogs su gshin rje'o //üîΩbden bral du srin po'o //üîΩnub phyogs su chu lha'o //üîΩrlung du rlung lha'o //
analyzed: gshin rje'i phyogs su gshin rje'o // bden bral du srin po'o // nub phyogs su chu lha'o // rlung du rlung lha'o //
translated: In the southeast is Agni.üîΩIn the southwest is Nir·πõti.üîΩIn the northwest is VƒÅyu.

original: nor sbyin du gnod sbyin no //üîΩ'phrog byed kyi phyogs su drag po'o //
analyzed: nor sbyin du gnod sbyin no // 'phrog byed kyi phyogs su drag po'o //
translated: In the northeast is ƒ™≈õƒÅna.

original: steng gi char tshangs pa'o //
analyzed: steng gi char tshangs pa'o //
translated: Above is BrahmƒÅ.

original: 'og tu khyab 'jug go //
analyzed: 'og tu khyab 'jug go //
translated: Below is Vi·π£·πáu.

original: brgya byin la sogs pa 'di dag mtshon ldan 'khor gyi skye bo dang bcas rang rang phyogs ni srung zhing skyong ba ste /
analyzed: brgya byin la sogs pa 'di dag mtshon ldan 'khor gyi skye bo dang bcas rang rang phyogs ni srung zhing skyong ba ste /
translated: These Indra and so on, along with their retinues, are the guardians and protectors of their respective directions.

original: de dag rnams kyi dbus su dus kyi 'khor lo rgyal ba rnams kyi skyed mdzad gzhom du med pa rdo rje'i sku ste /
analyzed: de dag rnams kyi dbus su dus kyi 'khor lo rgyal ba rnams kyi skyed mdzad gzhom du med pa rdo rje'i sku ste /
translated: In the middle of them is the Victor KƒÅlacakra, the indestructible vajra body, the producer of the victors.

original: phyogs skyong rnams kyi gtso bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyogs skyong rnams kyi gtso bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúchief of the directional guardians‚Äù is that.

original: da ni sa dum bu bcu gnyis la 'khor los sgyur ba chen po 'khor ba gsungs pa lhun po'i rgyab kyi phyogs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni sa dum bu bcu gnyis la 'khor los sgyur ba chen po 'khor ba gsungs pa lhun po'i rgyab kyi phyogs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, it is said that a great universal monarch cakravartin rules over the twelve sectors.

original: lhun po'i rgyab kyi phyogs rnams su ni sa gzhi dag la lha min kla klo rnams kyis rgyal bar dka' ba 'khor lo //
analyzed: lhun po'i rgyab kyi phyogs rnams su ni sa gzhi dag la lha min kla klo rnams kyis rgyal bar dka' ba 'khor lo //
translated: In the regions behind Meru, on the ground, the asuras and barbarians are difficult to conquer.

original: sa'i dum bu gang du de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos ni rnam par nyams shing de dag las bzlog pa'i chos 'jug pa'i sa gzhi der 'khor lo can 'khor te /
analyzed: sa'i dum bu gang du de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos ni rnam par nyams shing de dag las bzlog pa'i chos 'jug pa'i sa gzhi der 'khor lo can 'khor te /
translated: In whatever sector the Dharma of the Tathagata declines and the Dharma of its opponents spreads, the cakravartin conquers that ground.

original: rtsod dus la chos min rab tu @171b 'jug pa de nyid rtsod dus 'jug pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rtsod dus la chos min rab tu @171b 'jug pa de nyid rtsod dus 'jug pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The time of conflict is the time when the Dharma of its opponents spreads.

original: chos ma yin pa'i bdag nyid rtsod pa'i dus so //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa'i bdag nyid rtsod pa'i dus so //
translated: The time of conflict is the time of the nature of non-Dharma.

original: dum bu gang dang gang du kla klo'i chos zhugs pa'i dum bu de dang de nyid du rab tu gyur pas bgrod par byed pa ni rab tu bgrod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dum bu gang dang gang du kla klo'i chos zhugs pa'i dum bu de dang de nyid du rab tu gyur pas bgrod par byed pa ni rab tu bgrod par byed pa'o //
translated: In whatever sector the Dharma of the barbarians spreads, the cakravartin conquers that sector.

original: kla klo rnams dang kyang yig gis lha min la sogs pa rnams kyang g-yul du bcom ste /
analyzed: kla klo rnams dang kyang yig gis lha min la sogs pa rnams kyang g-yul du bcom ste /
translated: He will conquer the barbarians and the asuras in battle.

original: rang gi chos la kla klo la sogs pa de dag dgod pa byas nas mdun du rnam par rgyu'o //
analyzed: rang gi chos la kla klo la sogs pa de dag dgod pa byas nas mdun du rnam par rgyu'o //
translated: Having established the barbarians and so on in his own religion, he will proceed.

original: rdzogs ldan gsum ldan gnyis ldan dag dang rtsod dus gzhan ni dus kyi sbyor ba dag gis 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pa ni 'dir rdzogs ldan la sogs pa dus bzhi gzhan te /
analyzed: rdzogs ldan gsum ldan gnyis ldan dag dang rtsod dus gzhan ni dus kyi sbyor ba dag gis 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pa ni 'dir rdzogs ldan la sogs pa dus bzhi gzhan te /
translated: The other ages, the golden age, the silver age, the bronze age, and the age of strife, will occur through the conjunctions of the ages.

original: rdzogs ldan chen po la sogs pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rdzogs ldan chen po la sogs pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The other four ages, the golden age and so on, will occur, not the great golden age and so on.

original: dus bzhi 'di ni dus kyi sbyor bas 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dus bzhi 'di ni dus kyi sbyor bas 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: These four ages will occur through the conjunctions of the ages.

original: dus ni khyim gyi 'khor lo rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: dus ni khyim gyi 'khor lo rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The age is the twelve spoked wheel of the houses.

original: de'i sbyor ba ni dus kyi sbyor ba ste mtshams bzhi'i dbye bas 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba ni dus kyi sbyor ba ste mtshams bzhi'i dbye bas 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Its conjunctions are the conjunctions of the ages, which occur through the divisions of the four junctures.

original: dum bu gang du stobs ldan 'khor lo can te rab tu zhugs pa der ni rdzogs ldan dus bgrod de /
analyzed: dum bu gang du stobs ldan 'khor lo can te rab tu zhugs pa der ni rdzogs ldan dus bgrod de /
translated: In whatever sector the powerful cakravartin enters, that will be the age of the golden age.

original: rdzogs ldan dus zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos bgrod do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rdzogs ldan dus zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos bgrod do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The period called the ‚Äúage of completeness‚Äù is the period during which the Dharma of the Perfectly Awakened One is practiced.

original: rgyal po'i rgyab tu gsum ldan zhes pa ni rgyal po'i rgyab tu rdzogs ldan gyi mthar chos kyi rkang pa gcig med pa dang / gsum ldan gyi mthar rkang pa gnyis med pa ni gsum ldan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal po'i rgyab tu gsum ldan zhes pa ni rgyal po'i rgyab tu rdzogs ldan gyi mthar chos kyi rkang pa gcig med pa dang / gsum ldan gyi mthar rkang pa gnyis med pa ni gsum ldan du 'gyur ro //
translated: The ‚Äúage of three‚Äù is behind the king, that is, at the end of the age of completeness, one part of the Dharma is missing; at the end of the age of three, two parts are missing.

original: rtsod pa'i dus kyang rgyal po'i mdun dag tu ste /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i dus kyang rgyal po'i mdun dag tu ste /
translated: The ‚Äúage of dispute‚Äù is in front of the king,

original: bskal pa'i mthar chos kyi rkang pa bzhi med pa'o //
analyzed: bskal pa'i mthar chos kyi rkang pa bzhi med pa'o //
translated: at the end of the eon, four parts of the Dharma are missing.

original: gnyis kyi bar du gnyis ldan no zhes pa ni rtsod dus dang gsum ldan gnyis kyi bar du chos kyi rkang pa gsum med pa'i gnyis ldan no //
analyzed: gnyis kyi bar du gnyis ldan no zhes pa ni rtsod dus dang gsum ldan gnyis kyi bar du chos kyi rkang pa gsum med pa'i gnyis ldan no //
translated: The ‚Äúage of two‚Äù is between the two, that is, between the age of dispute and the age of three, three parts of the Dharma are missing.

original: dus bzhi po rnams dag gi lo'i tshad ni stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig ro brgya dag  dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: dus bzhi po rnams dag gi lo'i tshad ni stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig ro brgya dag  dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The measure of the years of these four ages is twenty-one thousand years, plus one hundred.

original: ro brgya zhes pa drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig gi tshad der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro brgya zhes pa drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig gi tshad der 'gyur ro //
translated: The two hundred and one is the measure of twenty-one thousand and six hundred.

original: re re dag gi tshad ni dus dang mda' yis bsgyur ba'i zhes pa la dus ni bzhi'o //
analyzed: re re dag gi tshad ni dus dang mda' yis bsgyur ba'i zhes pa la dus ni bzhi'o //
translated: The measure of each is the measure of time and arrow.

original: mda' ni lnga ste lnga bcu rtsa bzhi po de dag gis bsgyur ba ni dus dang mda' yis bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: mda' ni lnga ste lnga bcu rtsa bzhi po de dag gis bsgyur ba ni dus dang mda' yis bsgyur ba'o //
translated: Time is four, and arrow is five, and the measure of time and arrow is the measure of twenty-one thousand and six hundred by the four and fifty.

original: mi rnams dag gi lo brgya gang yin pa'o zhes pa lo brgya bsgyur ba /üîΩbzhi brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag lngar 'gyur te dus so so'i @172a * //
analyzed: mi rnams dag gi lo brgya gang yin pa'o zhes pa lo brgya bsgyur ba / bzhi brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag lngar 'gyur te dus so so'i @172a * //
translated: What is one hundred years of humans? is one hundred years.

original: tshad mnyam mo //
analyzed: tshad mnyam mo //
translated: It is five thousand and four hundred, and the measure of time is equal.

original: da ni mi'i lus skyes la sogs pa rnams kyi dbugs kyi tshad gsungs pa phra dbugs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni mi'i lus skyes la sogs pa rnams kyi dbugs kyi tshad gsungs pa phra dbugs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the measure of breath of those born in the human body, etc. is stated: subtle breath, etc.

original: phra zhes pa ni mi'i dbugs 'jug pa dang / 'byung ba gcig drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig tu gyur pa'i cha gcig ni phra mo'i dbugs te /
analyzed: phra zhes pa ni mi'i dbugs 'jug pa dang / 'byung ba gcig drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig tu gyur pa'i cha gcig ni phra mo'i dbugs te /
translated: The subtle is one part of twenty-one thousand and six hundred of the human breath entering and emerging, which is one subtle breath.

original: dbugs de drug ni lus skyes srin bu'i rigs la sogs pa'i chu srang gcig go //
analyzed: dbugs de drug ni lus skyes srin bu'i rigs la sogs pa'i chu srang gcig go //
translated: Six breaths are one finger-width for the beings born from wombs, and so on.

original: chu srang drug cu ni chu tshod do //
analyzed: chu srang drug cu ni chu tshod do //
translated: Sixty finger-widths are one period.

original: chu tshod drug cu ni nyin zhag ste nyin zhag ces bya ba ni lus skyes la sogs pa rnams kyi dbugs 'jug pa dang / 'byung ba drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig gi grangs so //üîΩdbugs de dag 'das pas mi rnams kyi rang gi nyin zhag go //
analyzed: chu tshod drug cu ni nyin zhag ste nyin zhag ces bya ba ni lus skyes la sogs pa rnams kyi dbugs 'jug pa dang / 'byung ba drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig gi grangs so // dbugs de dag 'das pas mi rnams kyi rang gi nyin zhag go //
translated: Sixty periods are one day and night, which is the number of twenty-one thousand six hundred breaths for those born from wombs, and so on.

original: dhru rnams kyi 'byung po yi dags rnams kyi rang gi nyin zhag ste /
analyzed: dhru rnams kyi 'byung po yi dags rnams kyi rang gi nyin zhag ste /
translated: One day and night of humans is one day and night of the gods of the Four Great Kings.üîΩThirty of these are one day and night of the hungry ghosts.

original: dhru zhes pa ni mi'i dbugs sum cu 'gyur gyi dbugs te /
analyzed: dhru zhes pa ni mi'i dbugs sum cu 'gyur gyi dbugs te /
translated: Thirty human breaths are one breath of the hungry ghosts.

original: nag po'i phyogs nyin mo dang dkar po'i phyogs mtshan mo ni yi dags pha mes la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi nyin zhag go //
analyzed: nag po'i phyogs nyin mo dang dkar po'i phyogs mtshan mo ni yi dags pha mes la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi nyin zhag go //
translated: The dark half of the month is day, and the bright half is night for the hungry ghosts, ancestors, and so on.

original: chu tshod ces pa ni /
analyzed: chu tshod ces pa ni /
translated: One period is

original: mi rnams kyi dbugs sum brgya drug cu ste lha rnams kyi dbugs gcig go //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi dbugs sum brgya drug cu ste lha rnams kyi dbugs gcig go //
translated: three hundred and sixty human breaths, which is one breath of the gods.

original: nyin zhag ces pa ni mi rnams kyi dbugs drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig ste lha min rnams kyi dbugs gcig go //
analyzed: nyin zhag ces pa ni mi rnams kyi dbugs drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig ste lha min rnams kyi dbugs gcig go //
translated: Day and night is the twenty-one thousand six hundred breaths of humans, which is one breath of demigods.

original: dhru zhes pa ni mi rnams kyi lo ste nus pa'i dbugs gcig go //
analyzed: dhru zhes pa ni mi rnams kyi lo ste nus pa'i dbugs gcig go //
translated: Dhruva is the life of humans, which is one breath of the powerful.

original: nus pa zhes pa ni 'og min pa'i skye ba'o //
analyzed: nus pa zhes pa ni 'og min pa'i skye ba'o //
translated: Powerful refers to the life of Akani·π£·π≠ha.

original: dus bzhi zhes pa ni mi rnams kyi lo'i tshogs drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig ste gtso bo'i dbugs gcig go //
analyzed: dus bzhi zhes pa ni mi rnams kyi lo'i tshogs drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig ste gtso bo'i dbugs gcig go //
translated: Four eons is the twenty-one thousand six hundred years of humans, which is one breath of the principal.

original: gtso bo zhes pa ni 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i skye ba'o //
analyzed: gtso bo zhes pa ni 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba'i skye ba'o //
translated: Principal refers to the life of those who go to the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment.

original: phra dbugs dhru dang chu tshod nyin zhag dhru dang dus bzhi dag ni stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig dang / drug brgya rnams ni rim pas lus skyes phra dang mi dang 'byung po lha dang lha min rnams dang ni /
analyzed: phra dbugs dhru dang chu tshod nyin zhag dhru dang dus bzhi dag ni stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig dang / drug brgya rnams ni rim pas lus skyes phra dang mi dang 'byung po lha dang lha min rnams dang ni /
translated: The twenty-one thousand six hundred of subtle breath, dhruva, hours, days and nights, and four eons are, respectively, the subtle life of the body, the life of humans, the life of bh≈´tas, the life of gods, and the life of demigods.

original: nus dang gtso bo'i nyin zhag gcig gi tshad de de ltar sngar brjod pa'i rim pas lus skyes la sogs pa 'di rnams kyi rang rang gi dbugs drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig gis nyin zhag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nus dang gtso bo'i nyin zhag gcig gi tshad de de ltar sngar brjod pa'i rim pas lus skyes la sogs pa 'di rnams kyi rang rang gi dbugs drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig gis nyin zhag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The measure of a day of the powerful and the principal is as follows: By the above-mentioned process, a day of these, beginning with the body-born, is twenty-one thousand six hundred breaths.

original: tshad  'di dag las nus pa'i tshad ni 'og min gyi lha'i tshad de sa @172b gzhi dag la 'khor lo can gyi dus bzhi nus pa'i tshad du 'jug ces so //
analyzed: tshad  'di dag las nus pa'i tshad ni 'og min gyi lha'i tshad de sa @172b gzhi dag la 'khor lo can gyi dus bzhi nus pa'i tshad du 'jug ces so //
translated: From among these measures, the measure of the powerful is the measure of the Akani·π£·π≠ha gods. On the grounds, the four ages of the cakravartins enter the measure of the powerful.

original: dum bu dum bur zhi ba'i go 'phang 'khor lo can bgrod dum bu so sor sangs rgyas kyi chos rab tu bskor nas zhi ba'i go 'phang bde ba chen po'i gnas bgrod do //
analyzed: dum bu dum bur zhi ba'i go 'phang 'khor lo can bgrod dum bu so sor sangs rgyas kyi chos rab tu bskor nas zhi ba'i go 'phang bde ba chen po'i gnas bgrod do //
translated: In each part, the cakravartins turn the wheel of the Buddha‚Äôs teachings and proceed to the state of peace, the abode of great bliss.

original: nyin zhag gcig la nyi ma bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: nyin zhag gcig la nyi ma bcu gnyis so //
translated: In one day, there are twelve suns.

original: dum bu so so re rer  'khor los sgyur ba chos rab tu ston pa po yang so so re re ste /
analyzed: dum bu so so re rer  'khor los sgyur ba chos rab tu ston pa po yang so so re re ste /
translated: In each part, there is one cakravartin who teaches the Dharma.

original: nyin zhag gcig la 'khor los sgyur ba bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyin zhag gcig la 'khor los sgyur ba bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: In one day, there are twelve cakravartins.

original: nus pa'i dbugs dang mi rnams kyi lo brgya phrag bcva brgyad bcva brgyad kyis re re bgrod de de ltar na chos kyi nyin mor byed pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi lam rab tu ston pa'i nyi ma bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: nus pa'i dbugs dang mi rnams kyi lo brgya phrag bcva brgyad bcva brgyad kyis re re bgrod de de ltar na chos kyi nyin mor byed pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi lam rab tu ston pa'i nyi ma bcu gnyis so //
translated: The capacity of the breath and the years of men are counted by eighteen hundredths, each one, in this way, the twelve suns of the Dharma, which is the day maker, which teaches the path of merit and knowledge.

original: phyi rol du lo la khyim bcu gnyis kyi dbye bas nyi ma bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi rol du lo la khyim bcu gnyis kyi dbye bas nyi ma bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: Outwardly, the years are divided into twelve houses, and there are twelve suns.

original: da ni phra mo la sogs pa rnams kyi dbugs kyi dbye bas nyin zhag so so la dus kyi dbye ba gsungs pa phyogs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni phra mo la sogs pa rnams kyi dbugs kyi dbye bas nyin zhag so so la dus kyi dbye ba gsungs pa phyogs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the division of time in each day and night by the division of the breath of the subtle and so forth is stated by directions, etc.

original: 'dir lus skyes la sogs pa rnams kyi nyin zhag so so la phyogs nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang / zla ba mtha' dag ces pa zla ba bcu gnyis dang / dus drug dang / dus bzhi dang / me dus zhes pa dus gsum dang bgrod pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dir lus skyes la sogs pa rnams kyi nyin zhag so so la phyogs nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang / zla ba mtha' dag ces pa zla ba bcu gnyis dang / dus drug dang / dus bzhi dang / me dus zhes pa dus gsum dang bgrod pa gnyis te /
translated: Here, in each day and night of the body born, etc., there are twenty-four directions, and the entire moon is the twelve months, and the six seasons, and the four seasons, and the three times of the fire season and the two paths.

original: rgyal po lo ni mtha' dag ces pa ni 'di mtha' dag lo'i dbye bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal po lo ni mtha' dag ces pa ni 'di mtha' dag lo'i dbye bar shes par bya'o //
translated: The king is the entire year, and this is to be known as the division of the year.

original: de bzhin du rjes su nyin zhag ni nyin zhag sum brgya drug cu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su nyin zhag ni nyin zhag sum brgya drug cu'o //
translated: In the same way, the days and nights are three hundred and sixty.

original: dus sbyor chu tshod dag dang chu'i srang rnams te dus sbyor ni sum brgya nyi shu lhag pa'i stong phrag bzhi'o //üîΩchu stod ni drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig gi grangs so //
analyzed: dus sbyor chu tshod dag dang chu'i srang rnams te dus sbyor ni sum brgya nyi shu lhag pa'i stong phrag bzhi'o // chu stod ni drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig gi grangs so //
translated: The muh≈´rtas, water measures, and water finger lengths are four thousand two hundred muh≈´rtas.üîΩThe water measures are twenty-one thousand six hundred.

original: chu srang gi stong phrag dgu bcu rtsa drug lhag pa'i 'bum phrag bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: chu srang gi stong phrag dgu bcu rtsa drug lhag pa'i 'bum phrag bcu gnyis so //
translated: The water finger lengths are one hundred and twenty thousand six hundred.

original: 'di rnams de ltar bgrod pa lus skyes la sogs pa rnams kyi nyin zhag so so la lo'i yan lag 'di dag dbugs kyi dbye bas bgrod do //
analyzed: 'di rnams de ltar bgrod pa lus skyes la sogs pa rnams kyi nyin zhag so so la lo'i yan lag 'di dag dbugs kyi dbye bas bgrod do //
translated: These are traversed in the breathing of each day of the bodies born from wombs and so on.

original: de la dbugs dgu brgyas phyogs su 'gyur te phyogs nyi shu rtsa bzhis nyen zhag dang lor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la dbugs dgu brgyas phyogs su 'gyur te phyogs nyi shu rtsa bzhis nyen zhag dang lor 'gyur ro //
translated: In that, ninety breaths make one finger length, twenty-four finger lengths make one muh≈´rtta, and eighteen hundred breaths make one day and night.

original: dbugs stong brgyad brgyas zla ba ste zla ba bcu gnyis kyis nyin zhag dang lor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbugs stong brgyad brgyas zla ba ste zla ba bcu gnyis kyis nyin zhag dang lor 'gyur ro //
translated: One thousand eight hundred breaths make one month, and twelve months make one year.

original: dbugs sum stong drug brgyas dus te dus drug gis nyin zhag dang lor 'gyur ro //üîΩdbugs lnga stong bzhi brgyas dus su 'gyur te dus bzhis @173a * //
analyzed: dbugs sum stong drug brgyas dus te dus drug gis nyin zhag dang lor 'gyur ro // dbugs lnga stong bzhi brgyas dus su 'gyur te dus bzhis @173a * //
translated: Three thousand six hundred breaths make one period, and six periods make one day and one year.

original: nyin zhag dang lor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyin zhag dang lor 'gyur ro //
translated: Five thousand four hundred breaths make one period, and four periods make one day and one year.

original: dbugs bdun stong nyis brgyas dus gcig tu 'gyur te dus gsum gyis nyin zhag dang lor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbugs bdun stong nyis brgyas dus gcig tu 'gyur te dus gsum gyis nyin zhag dang lor 'gyur ro //
translated: Seven thousand two hundred breaths make one period, and three periods make one day and one year.

original: dbugs khri brgyad brgyas bgrod par 'gyur te bgrod pa gnyis kyis nyin zhag dang lor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbugs khri brgyad brgyas bgrod par 'gyur te bgrod pa gnyis kyis nyin zhag dang lor 'gyur ro //
translated: Eighteen hundred breaths make one step, and two steps make one day and one year.

original: de ltar na lus skyes la sogs pa rnams kyi rang rang gi tshad kyi dbugs nyi khri chig stong drug brgyas so so'i nyin zhag dang lor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na lus skyes la sogs pa rnams kyi rang rang gi tshad kyi dbugs nyi khri chig stong drug brgyas so so'i nyin zhag dang lor 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the number of breaths in the individual measures of the body and so on make one day and one year.

original: de bzhin du dbugs drug cus nyin mtshan du 'gyur te nyin mtshan sum brgya drug cus nyin zhag dang lor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbugs drug cus nyin mtshan du 'gyur te nyin mtshan sum brgya drug cus nyin zhag dang lor 'gyur ro //
translated: Sixty breaths make one day and night, and three hundred and sixty day and nights make one year.

original: dbugs lngas dus sbyor du 'gyur te dus sbyor bzhi stong sum brgya nyi shus nyin zhag dang lor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbugs lngas dus sbyor du 'gyur te dus sbyor bzhi stong sum brgya nyi shus nyin zhag dang lor 'gyur ro //
translated: Five breaths make one period. Four thousand three hundred twenty periods make one day and one year.

original: dbugs gcig gis chu tshod du 'gyur ro //üîΩdbugs gcig gis drug cu'i chas chu srang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbugs gcig gis chu tshod du 'gyur ro // dbugs gcig gis drug cu'i chas chu srang du 'gyur ro //
translated: One breath makes one hour.üîΩOne breath makes sixty minutes.

original: dbugs sum brgya drug cu'i chas dbugs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbugs sum brgya drug cu'i chas dbugs su 'gyur te /
translated: One breath makes one breath.

original: chu tshod nyi khri chig stong drug brgyas nyin zhag dang lor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu tshod nyi khri chig stong drug brgyas nyin zhag dang lor 'gyur ro //
translated: Twenty-one thousand six hundred breaths make one day and one year.

original: chu srang stong phrag dgu bcu rtsa drug lhag pa'i 'bum phrag bcu gnyis kyis nyin zhag dang lor 'gyur ro //üîΩdbugs stong phrag bdun cu rtsa drug lhag pa'i 'bum phrag bdun cu rtsa bdun gyis nyin zhag dang lor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu srang stong phrag dgu bcu rtsa drug lhag pa'i 'bum phrag bcu gnyis kyis nyin zhag dang lor 'gyur ro // dbugs stong phrag bdun cu rtsa drug lhag pa'i 'bum phrag bdun cu rtsa bdun gyis nyin zhag dang lor 'gyur ro //
translated: Twelve hundred thousand and ninety-six minutes make one day and one year.üîΩSeventy-seven hundred thousand and seven hundred breaths make one day and one year.

original: de bzhin du dbugs 'bum phrag bdun cu rtsa drug lhag pa'i bye ba phrag bdun cu rtsa bdun gyis nyin zhag brgya dang lo brgyar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbugs 'bum phrag bdun cu rtsa drug lhag pa'i bye ba phrag bdun cu rtsa bdun gyis nyin zhag brgya dang lo brgyar 'gyur ro //
translated: Seventy-seven million and seven hundred thousand breaths make one hundred days and one hundred years.

original: mchog gi tshe 'di ni las kyi dbang gis rang rang gi tshad las lhag pa dang dman par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchog gi tshe 'di ni las kyi dbang gis rang rang gi tshad las lhag pa dang dman par 'gyur ro //
translated: The life of the best humans is not fixed, because it can be increased or decreased by the power of action.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rnal 'byor gyi stobs dang dka' thub pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis lhag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rnal 'byor gyi stobs dang dka' thub pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis lhag par 'gyur te /
translated: It can be increased by the power of yoga of the yogins and yoginis, and by the power of concentration of the ascetics.

original: dbugs gcig chu tshod du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbugs gcig chu tshod du 'gyur ro //
translated: One breath is one hour.

original: sems can sdig pa can rnams kyi sdig pa'i stobs kyis dman par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can sdig pa can rnams kyi sdig pa'i stobs kyis dman par 'gyur ro //
translated: It can be decreased by the power of the sin of sinners.

original: 'di lung dang rigs pa dam pas nges pa ni med de 'on kyang rig byed dag las skyes bu tshe lo brgya pa dbang po brgya pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di lung dang rigs pa dam pas nges pa ni med de 'on kyang rig byed dag las skyes bu tshe lo brgya pa dbang po brgya pa zhes brjod do //
translated: This is not established by the best scripture and reasoning, but it is said in the Vedas that a person has a life of one hundred years and one hundred organs.

original: 'dir mi rnams kyi mchog gi tshe lo brgya'o zhes pa'i tshig 'di ni spros pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir mi rnams kyi mchog gi tshe lo brgya'o zhes pa'i tshig 'di ni spros pa ste /
translated: Here, the statement that the life of the best humans is one hundred years is mere elaboration,

original: rdzogs ldan gyi dus kyi mi rnams kyi tshe 'phel ba'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: rdzogs ldan gyi dus kyi mi rnams kyi tshe 'phel ba'i dbang gis so //
translated: because the life of humans increases during the age of completeness.

original: 'dir nges pa'i don du skyes bu'i sgras nyin zhag so so dang lo so so brjod de /
analyzed: 'dir nges pa'i don du skyes bu'i sgras nyin zhag so so dang lo so so brjod de /
translated: Here, the word person refers to each day and each year in the definitive meaning.

original: nyin zhag brgya @173b dang lo brgyas nang dang phyi la'o //
analyzed: nyin zhag brgya @173b dang lo brgyas nang dang phyi la'o //
translated: One hundred days and one hundred years for the inner and outer.

original: slar yang dbugs kyi 'khor lo gzhan la 'jug pa'i phyir skyes bu tshe lo brgya pa dbang po brgya pa zhes so //
analyzed: slar yang dbugs kyi 'khor lo gzhan la 'jug pa'i phyir skyes bu tshe lo brgya pa dbang po brgya pa zhes so //
translated: Again, because of the engagement of another cycle of breath, the person of one hundred years is of one hundred faculties.

original: de ltar nang du nyin zhag brgya phrag gnyis kyis dus bzhi rnams su 'gyur te //
analyzed: de ltar nang du nyin zhag brgya phrag gnyis kyis dus bzhi rnams su 'gyur te //
translated: Thus, in the inner, the four seasons are made by two hundred days,

original: dbugs stong phrag nyi shu lhag pa'i 'bum phrag bzhi bcu rtsa gsum gyis so //
analyzed: dbugs stong phrag nyi shu lhag pa'i 'bum phrag bzhi bcu rtsa gsum gyis so //
translated: by forty-three hundred thousand breaths plus twenty thousand.

original: phyi rol du ni lo rnams kyis so //
analyzed: phyi rol du ni lo rnams kyis so //
translated: In the outer, by years.

original: de ltar 'khor lo gnyis ka yongs su 'khor bas skyes bu gnyis ka'i tshe zla ba gnyis dang dus gcig go //
analyzed: de ltar 'khor lo gnyis ka yongs su 'khor bas skyes bu gnyis ka'i tshe zla ba gnyis dang dus gcig go //
translated: Thus, by the complete revolution of the two cycles, the life of the two persons is two months and one day.

original: g-yon dang g-yas kyi dkyil 'khor bcu ste /
analyzed: g-yon dang g-yas kyi dkyil 'khor bcu ste /
translated: The ten mandalas of the left and the right.

original: lo stong phrag sum cu rtsa gnyis lhag pa'i 'bum phrag bzhis dkyil 'khor gcig tu srog rab tu 'bab bo //
analyzed: lo stong phrag sum cu rtsa gnyis lhag pa'i 'bum phrag bzhis dkyil 'khor gcig tu srog rab tu 'bab bo //
translated: In one mandala, the life-force flows for four hundred thousand years plus thirty-two thousand years.

original: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor lnga la gza' thams cad rang rang gi skye ba'i gnas stong pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor lnga la gza' thams cad rang rang gi skye ba'i gnas stong pa la 'jug go //
translated: Thus, in the five mandalas, all the planets enter their own empty birth places.

original: de nas yang rgyu ba gzhan la 'jug pas skyes bu gzhan dbu ma las nges par 'byung zhes pa ste 'chad par 'gyur ba la brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas yang rgyu ba gzhan la 'jug pas skyes bu gzhan dbu ma las nges par 'byung zhes pa ste 'chad par 'gyur ba la brjod par bya'o //
translated: Then, since it enters into another movement, it is said that the person emerges from the middle, which will be explained.

original: dpal mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad bsdus pa'i mdor bsdus te brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: dpal mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas las bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad stong phrag bcu gnyis pa dri ma med pa'i 'od las 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad bsdus pa'i mdor bsdus te brgyad pa'o /
translated: In the commentary on the glorious Supreme Original Buddha, the king of condensed tantras, the glorious Wheel of Time, the twelve thousand verses of Stainless Light, this concludes the eighth chapter, which is a summary of the measurements of the world systems.

original: // / da ni lo 'di nas ni zhes pa la sogs pas sham bha la'i yul du 'jam dpal 'byung ba dang / kla klo'i chos byung nas skar rtsis kyi grub ba'i mtha' rnam par nyams pa dang / nyung ngu'i byed pa rab tu 'jug par de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan pa bdag gis dgrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: // / da ni lo 'di nas ni zhes pa la sogs pas sham bha la'i yul du 'jam dpal 'byung ba dang / kla klo'i chos byung nas skar rtsis kyi grub ba'i mtha' rnam par nyams pa dang / nyung ngu'i byed pa rab tu 'jug par de bzhin gshegs pas lung bstan pa bdag gis dgrol bar bya'o //
translated: Now, from this year, etc., I will explain the emergence of Manjushri in the land of Shambhala, the decline of the science of astrology after the advent of barbarian religions, and the entry of the age of Kali, as prophesied by the Tathagata.

original: lo 'di nas ni drug brgya'i lo yis gsal bar mi bdag grags pa sham bha la zhes bya bar 'byung zhes pa la lo 'di zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pas chos bstan pa'i lo ste /
analyzed: lo 'di nas ni drug brgya'i lo yis gsal bar mi bdag grags pa sham bha la zhes bya bar 'byung zhes pa la lo 'di zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pas chos bstan pa'i lo ste /
translated: This year is the year in which the Tathagata taught the Dharma.

original: lo de nas lo drug brgya  na chu bo sh'i ta'i byang sham bha la zhes bya ba'i yul du grags pa zhes pa ni lung gi brjod pa ste /
analyzed: lo de nas lo drug brgya  na chu bo sh'i ta'i byang sham bha la zhes bya ba'i yul du grags pa zhes pa ni lung gi brjod pa ste /
translated: After that year, after six hundred years, in the land of Shambhala, to the north of the river Shait, the one called ‚ÄúGlorious‚Äù is the statement of the prophecy.

original: 'jam dpal grags pa chen bo gsal bar 'byung zhes pa sprul pa'i sku 'dzin par mdzad par 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'jam dpal grags pa chen bo gsal bar 'byung zhes pa sprul pa'i sku 'dzin par mdzad par 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúWill appear clearly‚Äù means that the emanation body will appear.

original: de nas klu'i lo brgya rnams kyis zhes pa ni grags pa mya ngan las 'das pa de nas klu zhes pa lo brgyad brgya nas nges par zhes pa ni @174a * //
analyzed: de nas klu'i lo brgya rnams kyis zhes pa ni grags pa mya ngan las 'das pa de nas klu zhes pa lo brgyad brgya nas nges par zhes pa ni @174a * //
translated: Then, after one hundred years of the nagas, after Glorious has passed into nirvana, after eight hundred years of the nagas, ‚Äúcertainly‚Äù means

original: gdon mi za bar mkha'i yul du kla klo'i chos dag rab tu 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar mkha'i yul du kla klo'i chos dag rab tu 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: without doubt, the religion of the barbarians will enter the land of the sky.

original: chu bo sh'i ta'i lho phyogs mkha'i yul grong bye bas rnam par brgyan par kla klo'i stag gzig rnams kyi lha ma yin gyi chos rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu bo sh'i ta'i lho phyogs mkha'i yul grong bye bas rnam par brgyan par kla klo'i stag gzig rnams kyi lha ma yin gyi chos rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the land of the sky, to the south of the river ≈öƒ´tƒÅ, adorned with ten million towns, the religion of the asuras will be well established among the barbarians.

original: kla klo'i de'i dus su 'dzin ma la ni nyung ngu'i byed pa gsal bar mi rnams dag gis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kla klo'i de'i dus su 'dzin ma la ni nyung ngu'i byed pa gsal bar mi rnams dag gis rig par bya'o //
translated: At that time of the barbarians, the people will know that the function of the sun is small.

original: grub pa'i mtha' rnams rnam par nyams pa zhes pa ni tshangs pa dang nyi ma pa dang / gcer bu pa dang skra can gyi grub pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' rnams rnam par nyams pa zhes pa ni tshangs pa dang nyi ma pa dang / gcer bu pa dang skra can gyi grub pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: The phrase the degeneration of the philosophical systems refers to the philosophical systems of the Brahmins, SƒÅ·πÉkhya, Nirgrantha, and ƒÄjƒ´vika.

original: 'di bzhi rnam par nyams pa ni grub pa'i mtha' rnams rnam par nyams pa'o //
analyzed: 'di bzhi rnam par nyams pa ni grub pa'i mtha' rnams rnam par nyams pa'o //
translated: The degeneration of these four is the degeneration of the philosophical systems.

original: mtha' dag sa gzhi la ni zhes pa la mtha' dag ni gang du mu stegs pa'i grub pa'i mtha' zhugs pa de mtha' dag go //
analyzed: mtha' dag sa gzhi la ni zhes pa la mtha' dag ni gang du mu stegs pa'i grub pa'i mtha' zhugs pa de mtha' dag go //
translated: The phrase on the entire surface of the earth means that wherever the philosophical systems of the tƒ´rthikas are practiced, that is the entire surface of the earth.

original: sa gzhi ni chu bo sh'i ta'i lho ste sa gzhi der ro //
analyzed: sa gzhi ni chu bo sh'i ta'i lho ste sa gzhi der ro //
translated: The surface of the earth is to the south of the river ≈öƒ´tƒÅ. On that surface of the earth,

original: sham bha la la sogs pa'i yul rnams su sangs rgyas pa'i grub mtha' rnam par nyams pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sham bha la la sogs pa'i yul rnams su sangs rgyas pa'i grub mtha' rnam par nyams pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the Buddhist philosophical systems have declined in the countries of Shambhala and so forth.

original: dus kyi sbyor ba la 'byung 'gyur zhes pa la dus kyi sbyor ba ni kla klo'i chos te /
analyzed: dus kyi sbyor ba la 'byung 'gyur zhes pa la dus kyi sbyor ba ni kla klo'i chos te /
translated: The phrase arising from the application of time means the religion of the barbarians.

original: de'i grub pa'i mtha' rnams la sbyor ba ni dus kyi sbyor ba las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i grub pa'i mtha' rnams la sbyor ba ni dus kyi sbyor ba las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The application of their philosophical systems is arising from the application of time.

original: dus kyi sbyor ba la zhes pa ni lnga pa'i don la bdun pa'o //
analyzed: dus kyi sbyor ba la zhes pa ni lnga pa'i don la bdun pa'o //
translated: The seventh case ending in the application of time is the fifth case ending.

original: grub pa'i mtha' rnam par nyams pa de'i phyir nyung ngu'i byed pa gsal zhes pa ni ma'i la ngu'i tshig ste /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' rnam par nyams pa de'i phyir nyung ngu'i byed pa gsal zhes pa ni ma'i la ngu'i tshig ste /
translated: Because of the decline of the philosophical systems, the phrase the manifestation of the function of the few is a word of the Mleccha language.

original: don dam par ni mu stegs pa rnams kyi nyung ngu'i byed pa la sogs pa gsal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni mu stegs pa rnams kyi nyung ngu'i byed pa la sogs pa gsal ba ma yin no //
translated: In reality, the manifestation of the function of the few and so forth of the tƒ´rthikas is not clear.

original: gang gi phyir grub pa'i mtha' rnams rnam par nyams zhes pa'i tshig zur gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir grub pa'i mtha' rnams rnam par nyams zhes pa'i tshig zur gyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the phrase the decline of the philosophical systems.

original: gal te byed pa la sogs pa gsal ba yin pa de lta na grub pa'i mtha' rnams rnam par nyams pa med de byed pa las kyang gza' 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te byed pa la sogs pa gsal ba yin pa de lta na grub pa'i mtha' rnams rnam par nyams pa med de byed pa las kyang gza' 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the sun and so on are the manifestor, then the philosophical tenets are not contradicted because the planets are established from the manifestor.

original: byang du bgrod pa'i nyin zhag la grib mas yongs su brtags pas byed pa gzhan la yang nyi ma dag pa ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang du bgrod pa'i nyin zhag la grib mas yongs su brtags pas byed pa gzhan la yang nyi ma dag pa ma mthong ngo //
translated: On the days when the sun moves north, the manifestor is not seen in the examination of the shadows.

original: byang du bgrod pa la grib ma dag pa med na nyi ma'i longs spyod ma dag go //
analyzed: byang du bgrod pa la grib ma dag pa med na nyi ma'i longs spyod ma dag go //
translated: If the shadows do not move north, the sun‚Äôs enjoyment is not pure.

original: nyi ma'i longs spyod ma dag pas zla ba'i longs spyod ma dag ste /
analyzed: nyi ma'i longs spyod ma dag pas zla ba'i longs spyod ma dag ste /
translated: If the sun‚Äôs enjoyment is not pure, the moon‚Äôs enjoyment is not pure.

original: de bzhin du bkra shis la sogs pa rnams kyang nyi ma'i longs spyod la sbyangs par gyur pa ni nyi ma'i longs spyod ma dag pa nyid kyi phyir de dag gi longs spyod kyang ma dag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du bkra shis la sogs pa rnams kyang nyi ma'i longs spyod la sbyangs par gyur pa ni nyi ma'i longs spyod ma dag pa nyid kyi phyir de dag gi longs spyod kyang ma dag go //
translated: Similarly, the auspicious planets and so on are purified by the sun‚Äôs enjoyment, but because the sun‚Äôs enjoyment is impure, their enjoyment is also impure.

original: de ltar gza'i longs spyod ma dag pa nyid kyi phyir mu stegs @174b pa rnams kyi gza'i 'bras bu skyes rabs la sogs pa rnams don med do //
analyzed: de ltar gza'i longs spyod ma dag pa nyid kyi phyir mu stegs @174b pa rnams kyi gza'i 'bras bu skyes rabs la sogs pa rnams don med do //
translated: Thus, because the enjoyments of the planets are impure, the results of the planets for tƒ´rthikas, such as the JƒÅtakas, are meaningless.

original: 'dir grub pa'i mtha' la gza' rnams kyi bgrod pa bud med dang byis pa rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba yin na byis pa'i skye bo la sogs pa de dag rnams kyis gza' myur du shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir grub pa'i mtha' la gza' rnams kyi bgrod pa bud med dang byis pa rnams kyis bsgrub par bya ba yin na byis pa'i skye bo la sogs pa de dag rnams kyis gza' myur du shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, in our system, the movements of the planets are to be accomplished by women and children. Those children and so on will quickly understand the planets.

original: des na phrag dog gi cha las skyes pa'i mu stegs gdug pa rnams kyis gal te bud med dang byis pa la sogs pa thams cad kyis gza'i rgyu ba shes par gyur pa de lta na bdag cag la su zhig gus par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: des na phrag dog gi cha las skyes pa'i mu stegs gdug pa rnams kyis gal te bud med dang byis pa la sogs pa thams cad kyis gza'i rgyu ba shes par gyur pa de lta na bdag cag la su zhig gus par byed par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, the evil tƒ´rthikas, who are born from the part of envy, think, ‚ÄúIf all women and children and so on understand the movements of the planets, who will respect us?‚Äù

original: de'i phyir grub pa'i mtha' sbas te rgyud kyi byed pa la sogs pa bya'o zhes gros byas nas grub pa'i mtha' rnams sba ba byas shing rgyud kyi byed pa la sogs pa gsal bar byas te /üîΩgang gis byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyis mi bzad pa mthong nas ring du 'bros par byed cing skar rtsis kyi ming mi byed par 'gyur ba rgyud la nyin zhag gi tshogs kyi phung po du ma dang byed pa la yang dal ba dang myur ba la sogs
analyzed: de'i phyir grub pa'i mtha' sbas te rgyud kyi byed pa la sogs pa bya'o zhes gros byas nas grub pa'i mtha' rnams sba ba byas shing rgyud kyi byed pa la sogs pa gsal bar byas te / gang gis byis pa'i skye bo rnams kyis mi bzad pa mthong nas ring du 'bros par byed cing skar rtsis kyi ming mi byed par 'gyur ba rgyud la nyin zhag gi tshogs kyi phung po du ma dang byed pa la yang dal ba dang myur ba la sogs
translated: Having hidden the tenets, they made the activities of the tantras and so forth clear,üîΩso that childish beings, seeing this, would flee far away and the name of astrology would not be used.

original: pa'i las bzhi'i spros pa byas so //
analyzed: pa'i las bzhi'i spros pa byas so //
translated: In the tantras, they made elaborations of the four actions of slow and fast and so forth with respect to the many heaps of collections of days.

original: de ltar dus kyi dbang gis byed pa la  nges pa mi gsal te /üîΩmi gsal ba nyid kyi phyir nyi ma'i longs spyod mi dag go //
analyzed: de ltar dus kyi dbang gis byed pa la  nges pa mi gsal te / mi gsal ba nyid kyi phyir nyi ma'i longs spyod mi dag go //
translated: Thus, due to the power of time, the actions are not clear.üîΩBecause of the lack of clarity, the enjoyments of the sun are not pure.

original: nyi ma'i longs spyod ma dag pas gza' thams cad kyi longs spyod ma dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma'i longs spyod ma dag pas gza' thams cad kyi longs spyod ma dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the enjoyments of the sun are not pure, the enjoyments of all the planets become impure.

original: 'dir gdug pa'i mu stegs rnams kyis gzhan dag gis mi shes par bya ba'i don du byed pa la sogs pa bkod pa gang yin pa de nyid dus kyi dbang gis de dag gis yongs su mi shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir gdug pa'i mu stegs rnams kyis gzhan dag gis mi shes par bya ba'i don du byed pa la sogs pa bkod pa gang yin pa de nyid dus kyi dbang gis de dag gis yongs su mi shes par 'gyur te /
translated: Here, whatever the wicked tirthikas have set forth for the purpose of making others ignorant, by the power of time they themselves become ignorant of it,

original: gzhan la gnod pa byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la gnod pa byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have harmed others.

original: de'i phyir gzhan la gnod pa byed pa ni thams cad du 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan la gnod pa byed pa ni thams cad du 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, harming others is always wrong.

original: 'dir nyin zhag so so la gza' rnams kyi longs spyod bgrod pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba las brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir nyin zhag so so la gza' rnams kyi longs spyod bgrod pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba las brjod par bya'o //
translated: Here, the movement of the planets through the daily periods will be described in the chapter to come.

original: da ni re zhig nyung ngu'i byed pa gsungs pa me mkha' rgya mtsho rnams zhes pa'o //
analyzed: da ni re zhig nyung ngu'i byed pa gsungs pa me mkha' rgya mtsho rnams zhes pa'o //
translated: Now, the function of the few is stated: fire, space, and ocean.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po 'di la nges pa ni mi rtag pa ste lo drug cu'i mthar slar yang nges pa 'god pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po 'di la nges pa ni mi rtag pa ste lo drug cu'i mthar slar yang nges pa 'god pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this king of tantras, certainty is impermanent, because after sixty years certainty is set forth again.

original: 'dir byed pa la nges pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dus nas lo drug brgya na 'jam dpal gyi dus so //
analyzed: 'dir byed pa la nges pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dus nas lo drug brgya na 'jam dpal gyi dus so //
translated: Here, the certainty of the function is that after six hundred years from the time of the Tathagata, it is the time of Manjusri.

original: de nas lo brgyad brgya na kla klo'i dus so //
analyzed: de nas lo brgyad brgya na kla klo'i dus so //
translated: Then, after eight hundred years, the Kali Yuga.

original: kla klo'i dus de las brgyad cu rtsa gnyis lhag pa'i brgyas dman pa ni rgyal dka' @175a * //
analyzed: kla klo'i dus de las brgyad cu rtsa gnyis lhag pa'i brgyas dman pa ni rgyal dka' @175a * //
translated: From that Kali Yuga, after subtracting one hundred less eighty-two, the DvƒÅpara Yuga.

original: gang gis nyung ngu'i byed pa rnam par sbyong ba rigs ldan rnal dka'i dus so //
analyzed: gang gis nyung ngu'i byed pa rnam par sbyong ba rigs ldan rnal dka'i dus so //
translated: By which the function of the lesser is purified, the K·πõta Yuga of the noble ones.

original: dus de nyid ni byed pa la nges par 'gyur te kla klo'i lo las so //
analyzed: dus de nyid ni byed pa la nges par 'gyur te kla klo'i lo las so //
translated: That very time becomes fixed in function, from the year of the Kali Yuga.

original: rab byung la sogs 'das pa zhes pa ni lo drug cu po gang dag gi dang po rab byung yin pa de dag ni rab byung la sogs pa ste de dag las so sor da ltar ba'i lo'i snga ma'i lo ni rab byung la sogs 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rab byung la sogs 'das pa zhes pa ni lo drug cu po gang dag gi dang po rab byung yin pa de dag ni rab byung la sogs pa ste de dag las so sor da ltar ba'i lo'i snga ma'i lo ni rab byung la sogs 'das pa'o //
translated: The past of the ascetic, etc. refers to those sixty years whose beginning is the ascetic. Those are the ascetic, etc. From those, the year prior to the present year is the past of the ascetic, etc.

original: de dag gsum lhag pa'i bzhi brgya'i phung po la bsres pa ni kla klo'i lor rab tu grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gsum lhag pa'i bzhi brgya'i phung po la bsres pa ni kla klo'i lor rab tu grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Adding that to the collection of four hundred plus three establishes the year of the Kali Yuga.

original: lo gcig dang por byas nas lo drug cu ji snyed pa de snyed ni rab byung la sogs 'das pa rnam bsres su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo gcig dang por byas nas lo drug cu ji snyed pa de snyed ni rab byung la sogs 'das pa rnam bsres su 'gyur ro //
translated: Having made the one year the first, as many as the sixty years, that many are the mixed past of the ascetic, etc.

original: lo de nyid ni byed pa gzhan thams cad la rab tu grags pa yin te gza' nyi ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lo de nyid ni byed pa gzhan thams cad la rab tu grags pa yin te gza' nyi ma bzhin no //
translated: That very year is well known for all other activities, like the sun.

original: gsum lhag pa'i bzhi brgya'i lo'i phung po la des bsres pa ni kla klo'i lor rab tu grub ste /
analyzed: gsum lhag pa'i bzhi brgya'i lo'i phung po la des bsres pa ni kla klo'i lor rab tu grub ste /
translated: The sum of the years of the barbarians is established as the year of the barbarians, mixed with that, in the aggregate of four hundred years plus three.

original: kla klo ni sbrang rtsi'i blo gros te rahma na'i 'jug pa kla klo'i chos ston pa po kla klo stag gzig rnams kyi bla ma dang rje bo'o //üîΩkla klo'i dbang po'i lo ni lag pa gdengs can zla bas dman pa brgyad cu rtsa gnyis lhag pa'i brgyas dman pa ni lag pa gdengs can zla bas dman pa ste /

translated: The barbarian is Madhu-mati, the one who enters the RƒÅmƒÅya·πáa, the teacher of the barbarian religion, the guru and lord of the Persians.

original: sham bha la'i yul du rigs ldan rgyal dka'i dus kyi lo'o //
analyzed: sham bha la'i yul du rigs ldan rgyal dka'i dus kyi lo'o //
translated: The year of the lord of the barbarians is one hundred less than eighty-two, less by one Candra of the outstretched hand, which is the year of the K·πõta age in the land of Shambhala.

original: de nyid ni nyung ngu'i byed pa la lo'i tshogs so //
analyzed: de nyid ni nyung ngu'i byed pa la lo'i tshogs so //

analyzed: mkha' me zla bas rnam par dbye zhes pa ni 'dir zla ba phyed dang bcas pa'i sum cu rtsa gnyis na lhag pa'i zla bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the remaining month is the thirty-second month together with half a month.

original: gnam stong la nyi ma'i 'pho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnam stong la nyi ma'i 'pho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no solar revolution on the thirtieth day of the month.

original: des na longs spyod par mi 'gyur @175b ro ;
analyzed: des na longs spyod par mi 'gyur @175b ro ;
translated: Therefore, the remaining month is not a month of enjoyment.

original: / de'i phung po bzhis bsgyur ba ni cha'i phung por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de'i phung po bzhis bsgyur ba ni cha'i phung por 'gyur ro //
translated: The remaining month is multiplied by four to obtain the measure of the aggregate.

original: cha'i phung po bzhis bsgyur bar gyur pa na rgyu med na rgyu can yang mi 'byung ngo zhes pa'i rigs pas bgo bar bya ba'i phung po bzhis bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cha'i phung po bzhis bsgyur bar gyur pa na rgyu med na rgyu can yang mi 'byung ngo zhes pa'i rigs pas bgo bar bya ba'i phung po bzhis bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the measure of the aggregate is multiplied by four, it is divided by four, because if the cause does not exist, the effect does not exist.

original: de'i phyir bgo bar bya ba'i phung po la cha'i phung pos rnyed pa ni 'bras bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bgo bar bya ba'i phung po la cha'i phung pos rnyed pa ni 'bras bur 'gyur te /
translated: The measure of the aggregate is obtained by the measure of the aggregate in the division.

original: rnyed pa steng du bsres pa rnyed pa lhag pa'i zla ba'i tshogs de nyid steng gi phung po'i zla ba'i tshogs la bsres pa dag ni mi'i bdag po zla ba'i tshogs pa rnam par dag par 'gyur te /üîΩda ltar gyi zla ba la tshes sum cu'i rtsis kyi don du'o //üîΩda ni zla ba'i nges pa gsungs pa zla ba gnas gsum gyur pa'i dbus ma'i phung po dag la gang gnas lag pa rtse mo can gyi bsgyur zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rnyed pa steng du bsres pa rnyed pa lhag pa'i zla ba'i tshogs de nyid steng gi phung po'i zla ba'i tshogs la bsres pa dag ni mi'i bdag po zla ba'i tshogs pa rnam par dag par 'gyur te / da ltar gyi zla ba la tshes sum cu'i rtsis kyi don du'o // da ni zla ba'i nges pa gsungs pa zla ba gnas gsum gyur pa'i dbus ma'i phung po dag la gang gnas lag pa rtse mo can gyi bsgyur zhes pa ste /
translated: The lord of men becomes pure in the assembly of the moon.üîΩNow, the statement of the rule of the moon is:üîΩThe one that abides in the middle heap of the three abodes of the moon is multiplied by the hand with a point.

original: 'dir zla ba dag pa gnas gsum du byas nas gang zhig dbus ma'i phung po la gnas pa'i zla ba de dag zla ba so so'i gza'i chu tshod kyi don du lag pa rtse mo can gyis bsgyur ba ni sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis bsgyur ba yin no
analyzed: 'dir zla ba dag pa gnas gsum du byas nas gang zhig dbus ma'i phung po la gnas pa'i zla ba de dag zla ba so so'i gza'i chu tshod kyi don du lag pa rtse mo can gyis bsgyur ba ni sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis bsgyur ba yin no
translated: Here, having made the pure moon into three abodes, the one that abides in the middle heap of the moon is multiplied by the hand with a point for the purpose of the lunar mansions of each moon.

original: // rtsa ba dag la drug gi chas rnyed ces pa ni rtsa ba'i phung po la drug gi chas rnyed pa dbus ma'i phung po la bu lon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // rtsa ba dag la drug gi chas rnyed ces pa ni rtsa ba'i phung po la drug gi chas rnyed pa dbus ma'i phung po la bu lon du 'gyur ro //
translated: The text says, ‚ÄúThe root [signs] are found by six parts,‚Äù meaning that the root signs are found by six parts. The middle sign is a debt.

original: des dbus ma'i phung po la sbyang bar bya ste bu lon yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des dbus ma'i phung po la sbyang bar bya ste bu lon yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By that, the middle sign is to be cleared, because it is a debt.

original: steng 'og dag la mig dang sum cu'i nor ni bsres pa gsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: steng 'og dag la mig dang sum cu'i nor ni bsres pa gsal bar bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe eye and thirty in the upper and lower [signs] are mixed and clarified.‚Äù

original: nges pa 'di ni mig dmar la sogs pa nub par byed pa la 'ongs pa ste /
analyzed: nges pa 'di ni mig dmar la sogs pa nub par byed pa la 'ongs pa ste /
translated: This rule is for the setting of Mars and so on.

original: des na nyi ma la sogs pa 'char bar byed pa'i don du steng gi phung por gza' gnyis nor du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na nyi ma la sogs pa 'char bar byed pa'i don du steng gi phung por gza' gnyis nor du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, for the purpose of the rising of the sun and so on, two planets are added to the upper sign.

original: 'og gi phung por chu tshod sum cu nor du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'og gi phung por chu tshod sum cu nor du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thirty hours are added to the lower sign.

original: de'i phyir steng dang 'og la grangs bzhin du mig dang sum cu bsre'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir steng dang 'og la grangs bzhin du mig dang sum cu bsre'o //
translated: Therefore, the eye and thirty are mixed in the upper and lower [signs] respectively.

original: drug cu'i cha dag gis rnyed pa rtsa ba'i chu tshod kyi phung po la drug cu'i chas rnyed pa ni gza'i tshogs su 'gyur te /
analyzed: drug cu'i cha dag gis rnyed pa rtsa ba'i chu tshod kyi phung po la drug cu'i chas rnyed pa ni gza'i tshogs su 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe finding by sixty parts‚Äù means that the finding by sixty parts in the root hour sign is the group of planets.

original: lhag ma ni gza'i longs spyod la chu tshod kyi phung por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag ma ni gza'i longs spyod la chu tshod kyi phung por 'gyur ro //
translated: The remainder is the group of hours of the planet's enjoyment.

original: steng du rab bsres drug cu'i chas rnyed pa'i gza'i tshogs de nyid steng gi gza'i phung po la rab tu bsres pa yin no //
analyzed: steng du rab bsres drug cu'i chas rnyed pa'i gza'i tshogs de nyid steng gi gza'i phung po la rab tu bsres pa yin no //
translated: That very group of planets, multiplied by the sixty-fourth part, is the group of upper planets.

original: thub pa mchog rnams dag gis te bdun gyis bcad pa ste rnam par phye bar gyur pa'i lhag ma de ni gza' nyid do //
analyzed: thub pa mchog rnams dag gis te bdun gyis bcad pa ste rnam par phye bar gyur pa'i lhag ma de ni gza' nyid do //
translated: The remainder, divided by seven, is the planet itself.

original: zla ba'i nges pa la gza' ni steng du dgod par bya zhing gza'i 'og tu chu tshod kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: zla ba'i nges pa la gza' ni steng du dgod par bya zhing gza'i 'og tu chu tshod kyi tshogs so //
translated: In the rule of the moon, the planets are to be placed above, and the group of hours below the planets.

original: @176a * // da ni gza'i rkang pa rnams gsungs pa gnas gnyis nyi zla bsres pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: @176a * // da ni gza'i rkang pa rnams gsungs pa gnas gnyis nyi zla bsres pa zhes pa ste /
translated: Now the feet of the planets are stated: The two places, the sun and moon, are mixed.

original: gnas gnyis la zla ba'i tshogs de nyid nyi zla bsres pa ni brgya rtsa bcu gnyis bsres pa ste /
analyzed: gnas gnyis la zla ba'i tshogs de nyid nyi zla bsres pa ni brgya rtsa bcu gnyis bsres pa ste /
translated: That very group of moons in the two places, the sun and moon mixed, is mixed with 112.

original: nyi zla zhes pa ni byed pa la ltos pa yin gyi grub pa'i mtha' la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyi zla zhes pa ni byed pa la ltos pa yin gyi grub pa'i mtha' la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Sun and moon depends on the action, not on the philosophy.

original: dus dang nyi mas thob pa 'og gi zla ba'i tshogs la brgya nyi shu rtsa drug gis thob pa ste /
analyzed: dus dang nyi mas thob pa 'og gi zla ba'i tshogs la brgya nyi shu rtsa drug gis thob pa ste /
translated: The time and sun obtainment is the obtention of the group of lower moons by one hundred and twenty six.

original: rnyed pa ni steng gi phung por nor du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnyed pa ni steng gi phung por nor du 'gyur ro //
translated: The gain is the upper aggregate, which becomes wealth.

original: steng gi phung po la sbyin par bya ste zla ba so so la tshogs gnyis kyi don du dang po lag pas bsgyur ba la phyi nas sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: steng gi phung po la sbyin par bya ste zla ba so so la tshogs gnyis kyi don du dang po lag pas bsgyur ba la phyi nas sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The upper aggregate is to be given, and on each moon, the group of two is to be given first by the hand, and later by the body.

original: 'byung ba bsres pa mtha' dag ces bya ba ni byed pa la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba bsres pa mtha' dag ces bya ba ni byed pa la ltos pa'o //
translated: The entire mixture of elements is said to be dependent on the agent.

original: dus dang nyi mas cha thob pa ni grub pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: dus dang nyi mas cha thob pa ni grub pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: The time and sun obtainment is the conclusion.

original: gang gi phyir zla ba brgya nyi shu rtsa drug na tshogs kyi gnas su tshogs gcig lhag par 'gyur ba'i zla ba'i rkang pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zla ba brgya nyi shu rtsa drug na tshogs kyi gnas su tshogs gcig lhag par 'gyur ba'i zla ba'i rkang pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: Because when one hundred and twenty six moons have passed, by the power of the foot of the moon, one group will be in excess in the place of the group.

original: brgya dang gnyis kyis phye ba chags zhes pa ni nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyis phye ba tshogs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brgya dang gnyis kyis phye ba chags zhes pa ni nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyis phye ba tshogs su 'gyur ro //
translated: The passion of the division by one hundred and two is the group divided by twenty eight.

original: gza' bdun gyi rkang pa yin pa'i phyir nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyi char 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gza' bdun gyi rkang pa yin pa'i phyir nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyi char 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is the foot of the seven planets, it is one twenty-eighth.

original: cha des thob pa ni zla ba so so'i gza'i rkang par 'gyur te gza'i chu tshod kyi 'og tu'o //
analyzed: cha des thob pa ni zla ba so so'i gza'i rkang par 'gyur te gza'i chu tshod kyi 'og tu'o //
translated: The part obtained by that is the foot of the individual planet of the moon, below the planet hours.

original: dus dang nyi mas cha thob pa'i lhag ma ni tshogs kyi cha shas su 'gyur te tshogs kyi 'og tu gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: dus dang nyi mas cha thob pa'i lhag ma ni tshogs kyi cha shas su 'gyur te tshogs kyi 'og tu gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The remainder of the part obtained by the time and the sun is the part of the collection, which should be placed below the collection.

original: da ni nyi ma'i skar ma'i nges pa gsungs pa gnas gsum dbus ma dag ni dbang phyug gis bsgyur zhes pa ste /
analyzed: da ni nyi ma'i skar ma'i nges pa gsungs pa gnas gsum dbus ma dag ni dbang phyug gis bsgyur zhes pa ste /
translated: Now, the rule of the sun‚Äôs stars is stated: The middle three abodes are transformed by ƒ™≈õvara.

original: zla ba dag pa de dag steng dang dbus dang 'og gi gnas gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zla ba dag pa de dag steng dang dbus dang 'og gi gnas gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: Those pure moons are the three abodes above, in the middle, and below.

original: gang zhig dbus ma la gnas pa'i zla ba de dag dbang phyug gis bsgyur te bcu gcig gis bsgyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig dbus ma la gnas pa'i zla ba de dag dbang phyug gis bsgyur te bcu gcig gis bsgyur ro //
translated: The moons that abide in the middle are transformed by ƒ™≈õvara, transformed by eleven.

original: bcu gcig gis bsgyur ba ni byed pa la ltos pa yin gyi grub pa'i mtha' la ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bcu gcig gis bsgyur ba ni byed pa la ltos pa yin gyi grub pa'i mtha' la ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: The transformation by eleven is in terms of the agent, not in terms of philosophy.

original: 'og ma dgu dang yon tan rnams kyis cha thob par gnyis bsres zhes pa ni 'og gi phung po la dgu dang / yon tan rnams kyis te sum cu rtsa dgu rnams kyis cha thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'og ma dgu dang yon tan rnams kyis cha thob par gnyis bsres zhes pa ni 'og gi phung po la dgu dang / yon tan rnams kyis te sum cu rtsa dgu rnams kyis cha thob pa'o //
translated: The two mixed with the nine below refers to the nine aggregates below and the qualities, that is, the thirty-nine.

original: gnyis bsres zhes pa ni byed pa la ltos pas bsres pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis bsres zhes pa ni byed pa la ltos pas bsres pa'o //
translated: The two mixed refers to the mixed by the agent.

original: dman pa'i dbus ma ni dbus kyi phung po la dman pa ste bu lon no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dman pa'i dbus ma ni dbus kyi phung po la dman pa ste bu lon no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The inferior middle is the inferior in the middle aggregate, that is, the debt.

original: chu tshod dag gis thob pa nor te zhes pa ni dbus ma'i phung po las chu tshod dag gis te drug @176b cus thob pa'i rnyed pa ni skar ma'i tshogs te steng gi phung po la nor du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu tshod dag gis thob pa nor te zhes pa ni dbus ma'i phung po las chu tshod dag gis te drug @176b cus thob pa'i rnyed pa ni skar ma'i tshogs te steng gi phung po la nor du 'gyur ro //
translated: The acquisition by the hours is the wealth, that is, the collection of stars, which is the upper aggregate.

original: drug cu'i cha'i lhag ma ni skar ma'i chu tshod du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: drug cu'i cha'i lhag ma ni skar ma'i chu tshod du 'gyur ro //
translated: The remainder of the sixty parts is the stellar hour.

original: nor de nyid steng gi phung por gnyis kyis ni /
analyzed: nor de nyid steng gi phung por gnyis kyis ni /
translated: That wealth itself in the upper aggregate is doubled.

original: bsgyur nas byin la skar mas bgos pa ste nyi shu rtsa bdun gyis bgos pa'i lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bsgyur nas byin la skar mas bgos pa ste nyi shu rtsa bdun gyis bgos pa'i lhag ma'o //
translated: It is divided by the stars, that is, divided by twenty-seven, the remainder.

original: mi bdag ni bod pa ste nyi ma'i skar ma la sogs longs spyod dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi bdag ni bod pa ste nyi ma'i skar ma la sogs longs spyod dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The lords of men are the Tibetans, and the stars, the sun, and so forth are the enjoyments.

original: 'dir steng du skar ma'i tshogs dang 'og tu skar ma'i chu tshod kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: 'dir steng du skar ma'i tshogs dang 'og tu skar ma'i chu tshod kyi tshogs so //
translated: Here, the group of stars is above, and the group of star-hours is below.

original: slar yang ma dag pa las kyang ma dag pa'i zla ba'i nges pa byis pa rnams kyis rab tu rtogs par bya ba'i don du bkod pa gza' la gza' ni rab sbyin gza'i gnas su gza' gcig sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: slar yang ma dag pa las kyang ma dag pa'i zla ba'i nges pa byis pa rnams kyis rab tu rtogs par bya ba'i don du bkod pa gza' la gza' ni rab sbyin gza'i gnas su gza' gcig sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Again, for the sake of the childish who understand the impure from the impure, the planets are set forth: a planet gives a planet in the place of a planet.

original: mi bdag nyis 'gyur chu tshod rnams te mi bdag ces pa ni bcu drug ste /
analyzed: mi bdag nyis 'gyur chu tshod rnams te mi bdag ces pa ni bcu drug ste /
translated: The lords of men are the double hours, and the lords of men are sixteen.

original: mi bdag nyis 'gyur chu tshod ni chu tshod sum cu rtsa gnyis chu tshod kyi gnas su sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: mi bdag nyis 'gyur chu tshod ni chu tshod sum cu rtsa gnyis chu tshod kyi gnas su sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The lords of men are the double hours, and the double hours are thirty-two hours, which are to be given in the place of the hours.

original: 'og tu tshogs dag la yang gnyis zhes pa ni chu tshod kyi 'og tshogs kyi gnas su gnyis sbyin par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'og tu tshogs dag la yang gnyis zhes pa ni chu tshod kyi 'og tshogs kyi gnas su gnyis sbyin par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And below, in the groups, also two, means that below the hours, in the place of the groups, two are to be given.
